description:
The check In was quick, however it took us 15 minutes until a server welcomed us and took our drink order.

Food was ok, clam chowder bread bowls were great and pizza was warm and flavorful. 

It took forever to get a drink refill. The service was the worse part. The employees were more concerned with the schedule than waiting tables.
author: Michael R.

description:
Waiter: are you guys ready to order?
Me: few mins please
Waiter: it's busy, you should put order in as soon as possible.

- Never had a waiter rush me to place an order before, unless it's last call before kitchen closes
- Expensive price point
- Food quality/portion was a disappointment
- The wait was short but bad customer service

Enough said, i will never go back.
author: Hannah N.

description:
I understand piers 39 is a tourists area, so everything would be a little overprice which is understandable as long as their quality are ok and looks ok too. 
It is a little sad to me that I paid 10.99 for 6 (tbh there's only 5 in planes) and there's no decorations at all, not only that there's just overflow spicy sauce which I guess some people are into it. The pizza is ok I'm not a picky eater but my friends hate it. The pasta are extremely expensive but with no decorations again and it won't feed any well-grown men. Last but not least, there's hair in the pizza...

Well... their view are great... but without other improvements I won't come here again.
author: Allen M.

description: Came here today and was a little hesitant once we walked in. The restaurant had just young adults as staff it seemed like. We were not greeted in a friendly manner just a simple "hey how are you? How many?" We were shown to our table from the host and my side of the table I had duct tape covering the all the holes in the leather but at least we had a view of San Francisco bay. Nikoleta was our waitress but I found that was her name once we got the bill. She never introduced herself and just went right to asking what we wanted to drink then once she came back she took our orders. I ordered the tortellini with a Stella Artois and both were actually pretty good and we got the cheesy garlic bread as an appetizer and that was delicious. I would say the food was the only highlight of the visit to this restaurant the staff were too young it seemed like and wrrwbf very professional at all or haven't really had any work experience in the restaurant industry.
author: Addison M.

description:
I was here on Friday with my co-workers. I'm from Sacramento, and we were in the area for the day for work. Our boss made reservations and honestly I was kinda skeptical because pizza is pizza and honestly you could get that anywhere lol. 
BUT what surprised me was that there was much more than just pizza on the menu. One of my co-workers got a salad that I nibbled on, and it was yummy. I ended up ordering the shrimp scampi, and I learned from our waiter that the shrimp was fresh (I had to ask...some places are right by the water and still use frozen fish). It was superb. I ate my food faster than anyone else at the table lol my only complaint is that there wasn't more pasta! The pasta was buttery, there was garlic mingled in, but definitely not to excess. And they were generous with the amount of shrimp in the pasta. Blows Olive Garden out of the water for sure!!
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Had a blast here today 
4th of July only 25 min wait 
We got very lucky , had an amazing table 
I had the shrimp scampi it was delicious 
Shrimp where small but good 
Clam chowder was delicious  
BBQ Chicken pizza was amazing definitely recommend . 
White Zinfandel paired everything nicely
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
I came here alone on a Tuesday evening and it was super slow inside. There were probably only 3 occupied tables inside that evening. My server Vladislav greeted me promptly when I arrived and sat me at the bar area. 

I ordered the mini chicken alfredo pizza ($11.99) and I was surprised by how well-portioned the pizza was for a Mini. Vladislav told me that the chicken alfredo was his favorite pizza on the menu too. I  really loved the chicken alfredo pizza. It was cooked perfectly and crispy. There was plenty of chicken and cheese on the pizza. The alfredo sauce was flavorful too.

Friendly service. Reasonable pizza prices (considering it's Pier 39). The ambiance inside the restaurant leaves a lot to be desired. Will I come back again? More than likely.
author: Philip M.

description: Came from LA during fleet week to do a little touring. Great pizza! Ordered a couple of mini pizzas. General manager Vladislav tended to us quickly and was very polite. Pizza came out in 10-15 minutes despite the restaurant being at full capacity. The pizza is homemade and you can tell. Had a great experience and would definitely be coming back when I'm in the Bay Area again.
author: veronica p.

description: It's a good pizza spot for the pier. They have a create your own section which is nice! Great service. Pizza is kind of greasy and the ranch isn't all that. But it's not horrible!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
We were strolling through Pier 39, looking for a place that was relatively cheap and easy to have lunch. Many of the counter service places were packed with people, so we moved to sit down places. Bubba Gump had a wait, so we landed at Luigi's since the pictures looked pretty good. We were not disappointed.

The service was really good as the waiters here were attentive, making sure to refill our drinks and even provide a cup of hot water to warm up a bottle. My wife and I split a pepperoni pizza that was really good. Although it was a decision made out of convenience and no wait, it ended up working out better than expected.

Overall, I would give this place a solid 4 - 4.5 stars. In fact, we will probably come here the next time we find ourselves on Pier 39. It is definitely a better choice than most of the tourist places in the area.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Worst Pizza, stay away. Im a pizza connoisseur  and I have tasted pizza's from All over U.S. and Canada. Lasagna edges burnt, prices high as expected because of the grest location. 
Washroom is pretty bad too.
author: Frank P.

description: Good pizza joint at Pier 39 in San Francisco. Traditional pizza crust, traditional sauce, topped with pepperoni, sausage, and onions. Friendly wait staff, made for a good pizza experience.
author: Greg S.

description: So went here on Sunday, it seemed pretty dead. We walk in and some waiter asked my boyfriend if we needed a menu, since there is one outside we didn't need one so my boyfriend said "no thank you we know what we want" I saw the waiter roll his eyes and walk away so upset. WHY?! So trying to ignore the immediate rudeness, we order 2 cokes and a medium pizza. While we waited our previous waiter told another waiter that was sitting in the NEXT BOOTH that he didn't want to deal with us! Woooooooooowww! So I told my boyfriend to check Yelp and of course all the complaints are basically about customer service. How are you going to treat customers this way and expect business. Feel sorry for the owner that have these rude waiters ruining his life business. Anyways I got up and told my bf let's just pay for the sodas and go down to chowders where I know the food is good and the people are friendly. Well they charged us $9.18 for the cokes and yelled at us for ordering food and cancelling! Wow I handed then a 10 and they said nothing and started to walk away and I asked for my change. I'm not tipping anyone a penny that yells at me. So please don't go here. They don't know what they are doing and they talk shit in their language thinking you won't understand. This place has a great view but it's so sad how they do business. So go down to chowders or literally any other food place on pier 39. Hope this place goes under.
author: Giselle L.

description: We were seated then forgotten, after about 15-20 minutes we finally had to walk over and ask them to come serve us, then we finally got drinks and one of the cups was dirty. Would not recommend there's way better choice at pier 39
author: Laura L.

description: Lonely restaurant. Sat us quick. As soon as they gave us the menu they ask if we were ready to order.  Shrimp pasta tasted old. 4 dollars for a soda ? Never again if I come visit San Francisco. Took for ever to bring our check. That only because we had to ask for it
author: Arely S.

description:
I've been coming here since I started working near by. Food was always meh. Came in today and met the new GM, Vladislav, and he is turning this place into a "must go to"! Pizza dough is now hand made and so flipping good! Expect to see more improvements in the next year and a line out the door. 

If you've been here before, give it another try- worth it!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Bay Bridge views. What a great place to grab a bite!

The manager came to our table to welcome us. Really enjoyed the service here.
author: Momchil K.

description:
Me and my friends were looking for a nice pizza place with a view for the oceans after a long walk at Pier 39. We went to Luigi's best choice that we could have made. The host great us, even though there were busy they sat us in no time. We order some appetizer Mozzarella sticks and Clam Chowder soup- delicious! We got Shrimp Scampi and Pesto Primavera - BOMB! Service was fast and everyone was very nice to us. The manager Vladislav came to our table to say Hi and to see how we were. I love the city and when I am there I will definitely visit this place! 
Thank you for everything 
Keep up the great work!
author: Nona S.

description:
It might not be fair to leave a review for a restaurant that I didn't end up eating in, but I definitely think my experience is worthy of sharing. It was a busy Sunday right around lunch time and everything was packed! My wife and I walked past Luigi's and noticed that there were lots of empty tables and no line, unlike the other restaurants nearby. Italian sounded good, so we thought we'd give it a go.

We waited at the host table and watched multiple staff walk by, make eye contact, and continue on with their duties. After several minutes, one of the servers came up to us and harshly confirmed "two?" and grabbed a couple menus then started to walk away. We assumed this meant to follow. He absently tossed the menus on a table and continued to walk. We hesitantly took a seat and noticed a table next to us that looked very annoyed. A lady at the table tried to get the attention of the guy who sat us (likely to get her check, as they all looked like they were done eating and eager to leave), but to no avail. 

After glancing at the menu and reading the body language of the other people at tables near us, we took a quick look at the online reviews and confirmed our concern that maybe we should look elsewhere for sustenance. We ducked out, unnoticed and went someplace else.
author: Nycole R.

description: I came in to this restaurant around 8:30 and was greeted by server (Caucasian) and right off the bat he told me we could only order to go. I was a group of 4 people so we were about to decide to walk out until Francisco (another server) came up to us quick and told us how many to be seated. So we decided to stay. He was fantastic and did very good job on serving us. The pizza was okay but the wings were delicious. But stand out of the place was Francisco. I even looked up at the time to see what time they closed and it stated at 10. Which to me I don't know why that guy was trying to kick us out. I felt very unwelcomed but Francisco made that up. I would gave it 5 stars but that guy took that 1 star. You guys need to hire more people like Fransisco. I recommend anyone who goes there to look for Francisco.
author: Oscar R.

description:
The pizza is neither good nor bad, it fits right in the "Meh" category.....It's Pizza and it can be consumed. My other gripe is when the bill comes, the prices don't match the menu and you're paying hidden fees for pizza.
I'm not exactly sure the customers come here by choice, it seems like it's the closest alternative after finding out the wait at Bubba Gump is too long.
author: Ken B.

description:
STAY AWAY!!!!! This place is awful. Host that checked us in completely forgot about us said it was a 5 to 10 minute wait and had us waiting about 25 min. Went to ask about our table since other parties of 6 were allowed in ahead of us. Keep in mind we were also a party of 6 so was confused as to how they were allowed in first. The host then went in panic mode running around finally trying to seat us. Once inside and seated we ordered our food and might i say the pizza was garbage. Cheese kept falling off all our slices. The only good thing i can say about this place is that the french fries were good and thats about it!!! 
P.S. TIP IS INCLUDED IN THE BILL NO CHOICE 
Save Your Money And Go Somewhere Else Not Worth The Price....
author: Michael A.

description:
This place is just "okay". As the previous reviews have stated, there weren't a lot of people. 
The clam chowder was watery and no where close to the other restaurants in the area. The cheese sticks were not fresh from the fryer (they may have sat there, while my pizza was being over cooked) my pizza was black on the bottom and I could tell it was left in the oven longer than needed. 
The place could use better cooks and better prices. My kids didn't even want to take the rest of the pizza for leftovers (final red flag).
Next time I want pizza at Pier 39, this will be my last choice.
author: Janece R.

description: We love the manager the restuarant was very clean .Angel was a server he was very helpful thanks for your recommendation. You guys are amazing.
author: Matey M.

description:
Visited this place with my family , we were in SF for the weekend . Ordered a large pizza and 2 drinks . Service is okay , food lacks flavor and is overpriced . Waited 20 min for our pizza . Paid with my card and a day later I find out they left themselves a $10 tip. YES you read that correctly I was so shocked and mad . I went back to the place and our server was there we told him and he got red and nervous (guilty reaction) he gave us every excuse not to total what we ordered . He was stuttering and said the manager was going to be there in 6hrs . I just walked out 
These people are frauds!!! I'm sure there are better places you can eat and get your money's worth . I don't recommend this place 

Remember: without our buisness these places would not be open!
author: Gonzalez P.

description:
Nice place.
I like the staff, and the pizza is delicious.
Good place for travelers. Try it out.
author: Ana M.

description:
Worst experience ever!!! 
The restaurant was half empty still me and my husband had to wait for 15 mins. The pizza we ordered was cold and the server never got us water.
The server was rude and unwelcoming. 
I'm never coming back.
author: Dnyanavi J.

description: One word. DELICIOUS!! The manager was one of the nicest I've ever met in my life and was extremely relatable. He was also very funny and enjoyable. He noticed the little details even when we didn't mention it. The pizza was perfect and amazing views of the bay, boats and cute sea lions!! Definitely recommend for a place to eat!
author: Shannon J.

description: We didnt have a good experience. I should have known that it wasn't good when the restaurant was nearly empty on a busy day. We went because the line at Bubba Gump was too long. We ordered 3 pizzas. The person who took our order repeated it back to me and had one wrong so I corrected him. Still somehow 2 pizzas came out with the wrong toppings. The mozzarella sticks were served with ketchup instead in marinara sauce and when we asked why they said they were changing the menu. Overall, for 3 medium pizzas, 2 mozeralla sticks and 4 drinks the bill came to almost $120 and the pizza wasn't anything spectacular. We should have stayed in the line for Bubba
author: Kareena C.

description:
I stopped by Luigi's with couple of friends and it turned out that we would be more people than expected. The manager was so polite and changed our table as quickly as possible ( I believe his name was Vlad). Also since the last time I came to Luigi's which was like an year ago I've noticed that the place now is much more cleaner than it used to be and the food taste better!

Tip: The chicken Alfredo pizza is a must try!

Definitely would come back soon.
author: Simona S.

description:
I went on a Saturday night and my wife, my friend and I wanted some Italian. We saw a sign saying there's a pizza place above us. Going up It was a bit hard to find, I thought there was going to be a long line but those were customers for other stores and restaurants. We found it and there was one party in front of us. It didn't seem busy but I'm sure it took about 10 minutes for them to get to us.

We get in and they put the menu on the table and leave us.  Not long after a server comes up to ask us what we'd like to drink and still needed more time to choose what we wanted. We got a soda and 2 waters. Normal so far, but then it gets worse. 

Someone gets back to us in a few more minutes and we order a chicken parmesan pizza. Wait about 15-20 minutes or so and still no sign of water. I had to hail a waiter who ran into my wife's chair without saying sorry. I ask for our drinks and he comes back 10-15 minutes later without my friend's soda, but holds 3 water cups at the same time our pizza came in. 

Not going to lie as bad as the service was the pizza was pretty good. I don't think it's $24 good but it was good. I'm trying to pay half and half for the check once we get it but they wouldn't let us for some reason. Said that it was a single item. Still shouldn't stop someone from paying $12 dollars from one card and $12 on another. 

The food and service is not worth the price. I don't recommend it.
author: Keith C.

description:
My sister was visiting San Francisco from out of town, and my girlfriend and I drove up from Berkeley to visit with her. While Pier 39 is saturated with options, my sister opted for Luigi's pizza. After reading their reviews on the way up, I strongly discouraged. But, kids like pizza, and they have beer.. soooo, how bad could it be.

Very, very, bad... 

The food was not only d i s g u s t i n g, but it was horribly, horribly-overpriced. Their pizza is crap. The food came out cold, and the cheese was already hard. The dough was your generic fast food-like pizza dough. Relatively flavorless, super salty, dripping oil, and likened to cardboard. I had one bite and decided not to waste space in my stomach with this, "food." Instead I got beer!

Hey, if there is beer, it's hard to complain. But the beer was warm and expensive.

The service is also painfully slow and apathetic.

The only reason this place is still in business is derived from the sheer volume of unwittingly people on Pier 39.

But hey! I guess as long as there is this level of business, there is no incentive to provide a better product. Terrrrrible food, terrible service, terrible prices. All and all an absolute negative experience. 

Way to go guys, you managed to literally do everything poorly. OHHHH YEAH!! Annnnd they have an 80% rating from the health department. So there is that.
author: Dave K.

description:
Phenomenal hands down best pizza especially since I have Italian blood very delicious 
Ordered the Luigi meat lovers; very tasteful delicious  
My wife ordered Luigi favorite phenomenal .
Read the view of here and someone mentioned the mozzarella sticks so of course I ordered it very fresh and delicious I'm a very picky person about my pizza and this was hands down the best  
If your visiting San Francisco (Pier 39) like me Check it out also try their bone less chicken spicy so good I took it to go this has been an awesome experience and I'm honored to visit the famous Pier 39
And to Check off my bucket list 
LUIGI 

THANK YOU FOR THE PHENOMENAL SERVICE
author: Nina S.

description:
Disgusting. I have worked on this Pier for going on 15 years on and off... And I usually bring my own meals to work but tonite I didn't and I decided to see if anything had changed (for the better) at this place but nope. The bathroom still stinks like vomit even after several years, maybe 5 years at least since I stepped foot in this place. Poor management in every respect. 

I miss the days before this new ownership. The guy who owned it before had a handful of restaurants throughout the city. Locals might remember it; North Beach Pizza. Omg I loved this spot back then and would pick up a huge slice of pizza at least 3x a week. 

No more :( It's just piss poor quality ingredients and horrible service. Filthy bathroom. I'm guessing that the only reason they stay in business is bcoz the tourists don't know any better. I'd be embarrassed as it is seriously a bad impression of food in San Francisco. I am 3rd generation native and it makes me cringe that this place exists at a tourist area of SF.

EDIT:
I just got done reading some of the past reviews by other yelpers and I thought I should mention the fact that I decided to finally write a review about Luigi's is because like so many others, I stood at the hostess station for damn near 15 minutes. The fact that I closed shop on a very busy nite to come here and just stand there waiting while I looked across the way and could see customers coming to my shop peering in the closed door, I'm losing business while at least 5 workers there were all in the food prepping area just too busy flirting or whatever with the one female worker person. Waste of my time!!!

Customers frequently ask for restaurant suggestions, and although we are asked by the Pier 39 management to plug and promote only the restaurants here, I won't ever mention this place. And if customers specifically ask for my opinion on Luigi's I will be totally honest.
author: Aimee B.

description: We came here on a Monday the restaurant wasn't that busy at all but we never got seated, after almost hour and half of waiting I went in to ask them how long would it take, seriously the waiters didn't care at all. They just looked at me and shrugged their shoulder. Very very unprofessional definitely can see they do not care about their customer disk how they are not closed yet.
author: Najma A.

description: Thank you Vladislav for awesome service and recommendations! The clam chowder was homemade and authentic! The calamari and cheese bread was great too! You made our sons birthday because all he wanted for his birthday was a day in SF and clam chowder and our  little ones loved their mini pizzas! You rock and thank you  for  making his day!  We will be back again!!!  this was worth the 1 1/2 hr. Drive!! Also, thank you for Sebastian's birthday cake (tiramisu) it was amazing! You went over and beyond!!
author: Debra I.

description:
Only ones in line, 5-7 tables open in door and out door, and we stood waiting
For someone to help us/seat us for 20 min. Terrible service. Wouldn't waste my time.
author: Audrey W.

description:
Since Ian loves pizza, we stopped here after spending considerable time on Pier 39 doing the touristy things. 

We ordered the following:
Presto Primavera Pizza
Vegetarian Pizza
Lagunitas IPA
Total with taxes and tip came to $58.60

Pros:
I don't know what the complaints about service were. Staff paid attention to us during our entire stay.

Cons:
Price is high for the pizza. But, this is expected as they have to pay for prime real estate. (-1)
Ladies bathroom was out of service.
Not many tables with a view of the Pier or the Bay.
author: Krishna C.

description: One of the worst experiences I've ever had. our waiter took our order then disappeared. I saw people that showed up after us getting served there food when our freezing cold appetizers showed up. Finally when our food showed up it was horrible obviously microwaved and smelled of burned plastic. Still can't believe how expensive that horrible meal was.
author: Frank S.

description:
Read the reviews on this place after we ordered and I was a bit scared. But I was pleasantly surprised. 
Mozarella sticks were crunchy on the outside but nice & gooey inside. The marinara sauce was good, had great flavor.
Pizza was great as well. Crust was soft and not "doughy". Sauce, pepperoni, and cheese was good.
Service was great. Drinks never went empty.
author: Alberto L.

description: The overall experience was mediocre at best. The pizza was fine (I was very happy that they had GF options), but I was over charged on my credit card by at least $9, and my friend was charged more than double her meal. I'm suspecting our waiter left himself a very large tip. I think that with my pizza with the special crust (no other drinks or food items) it should have been just about $30 with 20% gratuity. My friend who went with me only ordered a mini pizza, and had a $47 charge on her card from our visit. We will both be reaching out to management and potentially canceling our cards.
author: Joanna M.

description:
Terrible pie.  No flavor.  Nasty cheese.  Bland pie crust.  Marinara was undercooked. 

 This place has no business claiming to be Luigi Italian pizzeria should be just pizza shack or something. 25 bucks for nasty pizza.

Clam chowder was not creamy.  Was a clear sauce and not white.   Had plenty of clams and potatoes.   Also had celery and other good additive ingredients.   Gave it a twist . That was good.

Iced tea was too sugary.  Nasty.  And i love sweet.  Was a bad batch probably. 

Service was ok.  Many empty tables and we still had to wait 15 minutes ish.

5.5% surcharge for doing business in San Francisco. 

10% military discount on 1 item only.
author: Fatih S.

description: Very nice atmosphere and a beautiful  view! We ordered pizza and it was delicious, not greasy,  and really nicely done . Our server was very friendly and helpful.
author: Andrea M.

description: Id like to start off by stating that this place is a nice place considering all the options on Peir 39. BUT ...They have a limited bar for beer and wine but they do that a good selection for Italian cuisine. The portions are on the rather small side so take that into consideration if you do come here. It's nothing over the top and definitely defines meeting the minimum......But they are a good place to just go grab a sit down meal when all the better places have crazy lines. So it's up to you on what kinda meal you are trying to have.  (But Don't order the shrimp scampi )
author: Gabbie R.

description: I've been here with my friends and the service was great our waiter (really tall guy) had really good recomandations  and he was really pleasant.
author: Nenad P.

description:
Be prepared and you won't be disappointed. Order, drinks, apps, form of payment.. be ready and your experience will go better. Don't think you need to be prepared and you'll be spending lots of time sitting and waiting for someone to come back.. refills, boxes, check.. etc. This is a Good pizza spot with some nice views, it WILL take some time 15-20 min just for someone to seat you and there will be plenty of open tables. 15 min-20 wait to be seated. We made sure to have our order ready (have been here before) drinks, apps, pizza, etc so we could order RIGHT as we sat down. If you're prepared you'll be thankful not to have to wait 30 min to place your order. In about 10 min we got our fries and the large pizza came soon after, piping hot and delicious.  Waited about 10 min for the check and a box (had payment ready when box was brought back with check. In all since we knew what to expect took about 1hr 30min; seating, ordering, eating and check paid. 
Be ready (drinks & food, & have payment ready when check is brought to table) or it will take FOREVER for them to come back, they are ALWAYS short staffed.
author: LoriAnn S.

description: Good spot to visit at the Pier, one of the best Pizza i have tried in my life! The staff is realy friendly and there is amazing view of the Bay! Will come back for sure!!!
author: Ivan D.

description: Great place with a great view! I came here with my friends for pizza and was excellent! The crust was cooked perfect, brown and crispy. The service was very good, they checked us all the time we was last year in Luigis now the new management is great pizza is amazing. We will defiantly come BACK.I don't know  why the people complaining about the price  is normal to wait 15.20 min for a table.In Bubba Gump   the line was 2 hours. Im so happy we choice Luigis again thanks for everything guys you are amazing .if i can come to san francisco everyday i will eat here .
author: Ilca C.

description: I got tge fisherman's wharf pozza and it is very doughy my friend got the meat lovers and hers was doughy...the guy tried to make it seem as if it were the cheese..ugh
author: Aza G.

description: I don't normally write reviews for a pizza joint but I decided to even create a yelp account. With my family visiting out of the country we decided to take a visit to pier 39 and tucked backed in the pier is Luigi's pizzeria. We stood at the the door and were greeted by the manager and he gave us an amazing view of the Bay Area. Our server greeted us and and asked where were from and did an amazing job taking care of us. We ordered a chicken Alfredo and a treasure island which the servers and manager recommended. Our pizza came out quickly and man were they delicious and hot. I highly recommend anyone who's in San Francisco visiting to stop on by and have a pizza. We will definitely be back to eat on the weekends.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Excellent customer service from the GM Vlad! Thanks for the great experience for me and my friends.
author: Erica C.

description:
Came in at noon on a Friday, good service and great food! Customers began showing up around 12:30. We ordered pizza and clam chowder.
Sausage & pepperoni pizza was delicious! Just the right amount of grease and the cheese was soooo good.
The clam chowder was great. Not like any other clam chowder I've had before, a yummy mixture of textures, the potatoes were chopped and blended in perfect harmony with the clam and veggies.
$60 for 4 beers, a medium pizza and a cup of chowder. Not bad at all :)
author: Hannah D.

description: Was excited to eat here because of the atmosphere and menu however three stars because my husband had a dirty glass with something floating in it and halfway thru our meal it went from no background music to really loud house music all of a sudden which we didn't enjoy listening to. Food was okay, mini pizzas were very filling, you could probably share one between two people if you order an appetizer like we did.
author: Raeanna S.

description:
I usually don't leave reviews, but the service and food were both something to talk about. First let me talk about our server, Rjay. RJay is hands down one of the best servers I've had in a very long time. He was very personable, constantly refilled our drinks, and made amazing food suggestions. 

Now for the food. I went ahead and ordered the penne pasta which was incredible! My friends and I then shared a pizza and some mozzarella stick which were also to die for. 

Overall the experience was great and I would definitely come back here again for round 2.
author: Alfonso H.

description: Despite the low rating here on Yelp, my husband and I decided to give Luigi's a try since Pizza was on the brain.  On our way walking down the pier we contemplated a few other restaurants.  I'm glad we didn't.  When we arrived we were greeted promptly.  They weren't very busy at all.  I'm assuming because it is near the end of the pier, and there are so many other restaurants along the way. I wished I had gotten our servers name as he was very attentive and friendly and deserves a 5 star rating himself.  My husband and I both ordered salads, Caesar and house - both good.  We shared a pizza - the meat lovers (not the correct name).  It had, well - a lot of meat.  Ha!  Added jalapeños to spice it up.  The pizza was cooked perfect!  Not too thick, and just crisp enough.  Another nice part of our meal was the relaxing view!
author: Erin G.

description:
Not a good pizzeria or pasta restaurant. The only thing I recommend is bottled beer! 
Ordered the calamari and I swear it was so overcooked that it didn't taste like calamari. Even the salad was bad. 
Will never go back
author: Almendra M.

description: I wish I had taken a picture of the food before we inhaled it all. We got the BBQ pizza, caesar salad, mozzarella sticks, and buffalo wings. It's was all perfect! The service was great also
author: C H.

description:
This restaurant really makes a great pizza! We were greeted by Vladislav and was such a great host. Highly recommend this place A++ 

Highly recommend and will be back!
author: Sammy C.

description: Came here because we didn't want to fight the crowds at Bubba Gumps and I can't believe how much we enjoyed our food. The pizza was airy and perfectly cooked. The shrimp scampi was downright perfect...my picky kid cleaned his plate eating here is our new family Pier 39 tradition
author: Anthony B.

description:
The food was good, but so overpriced it's not even funny (as is the case with every restaurant in the area)!!! We paid almost $70 for two pasta meals, two sodas, and small salads. Also, SF includes this extra tax to cover health care for the employees; I appreciate that they offer healthcare, but it's frustrating that restaurants make customers pick up the cost and then charge tax on top of it! Yes it's a small amount (like $2-3), but the food is already a rip off and then we have to pay more because restaurants are stingy and make customers pay extra for their employees health care. The service was decent, but again, way too expensive. Sodas are $4, which is so overpriced it's not even funny. Overall the food was good, but not at all worth the ridiculous prices that Luigi's charges.
Also it's so loud in here you can't even think, they have music playing from a little sound system, but it's way too loud!
author: Ryan M.

description: The food is so good! Im so full but I cant put down my fork! I will for sure come back the next time I come to pier 39
author: Nakita M.

description: Probably the worst food I have eaten in my 17 years in the USA. Cold frozen chicken may work on a pizza but not on an $18 salad. Pizza came out cold not a hint of brown on the cheese. Would have given one star but at least they served wine.
author: Karen G.

description:
This place is way better than the reviews. It's not the worlds best pizza, but it was really good. I'm from Chicago and am fairly picky about pizza. 

We ordered the Luigis Favorite, thin crust, since the pizza looked a little too "bready" for my taste. It came to us thin and fresh, my only suggestion is maybe they could add more sauce, but that's being picky. 

Service was good as well. Maybe we went on a great day but to me, the other reviews are written by serious drama queens. 

If you want pizza, just eat here LOL.
author: Michael L.

description:
We came here for lunch and got a seat with a great view of the bay.  The service was exceptional both our host and server really treated us like special customers without feeling interrupted.  We had fast service and they offered lactose free cheese and I cannot find this option in the many gourmet pizza places and I really appreciated that!

Overall the views and the food were a surprisingly exceptional experience and it is a hidden spot on the second floor of Pier 39 near the end of the pier and hidden gem for casual dining.  Highly recommend to all!
author: Mee-Jin Y.

description: Pasta is always good and tasteful. However, portion was off on both orders. The most disappointing thing during my to go order was I was charged $47 for 2 basic pastas(3cheese). I didn't save my receipt since it is uncommon this happens. Overall, upset I was overcharged and not compensated when calling store very unhelpful.
author: Serg R.

description: I came to San Francisko on a vacation from Miami i was starving so i sit at Luigi's. Im very picky about pizza but this place grab all of the points from the hospitallity to the taste everything was excellent. I had a chat with the manager Vladislav really nice guy. He made sure everything with my dinner was fine and also he gave me some recommandations which places to visit and they were awesome as well. U gonna love this place
author: Nikolai B.

description: This restaurant was so good! The pizza was absolutely delicious, the general manager (who was helping wait tables because they were so busy) was attentive and came by multiple times to check up on all the tables. My family and I are from out of town and walked all over Pier 39 looking at all the different restaurants before finally settling on this one and we weren't disappointed! If we were local, we'd definitely be regulars.
author: Megan M.

description: I came here with some friends, the food was average. The reason I'll only give it two stars is because they include a high percentage tip in the total. Didn't even give us the option to change it. On top of that they refused to split the check. They want us to give them high tip yet don't even want to simply divide the orders?? Not coming back. I ended up paying MORE THAN DOUBLE  the amount for what I ordered just because they were too LAZY to split the check.
author: Akemi M.

description: Very friendly people, the server amazing, and the food is really great, a lot of flavor, the pizza and pasta pesto.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE.
author: Enrique H.

description:
Slav... thank you for a best service again  ! Know this guy from other places, the owners have to be so happy to have this guy in his team !!
See u soon again !!!
author: Yordan I.

description:
This is my favorite San Francisco restaurant . Great service , great food. The new GM Vladislav recently made some improvements and now the place looks even cleaner. He definitely made me and my friends feel welcomed and extra comfortable and was very accommodating altogether. 
Will definitely come back here again soon!
author: Victor I.

description:
With 2 more of my friends we wanted pizza and i start yelpping and i didn't like the reviews but we still went there . The Manager there was so nice he welcomed us sat us on a table and after the server took the order he was coming and check
On us from time to time , very nice guy from eastern europe. Also the place was very clean and the pizza was good dont even read the negative reviews if i have done that i would never expirience good pizza and good service while i was craving something nice . See you soon again !
author: Metodi H.

description:
Typical Fisherman's Wharf tourist trap. High prices, low quality, and spotty service.

Pizza was okay- not terrible but not good either. Service was rough- I had to practically corner another server to get hot sauce, red pepper, and parmesan. 

Nice view if you can get a window seat.
author: Katie G.

description: This place was awful!!!!  After sitting for at least 10 mins, someone finally came and asked if we wanted something to drink. That is where the service ended. We waited for someone to ask us if we wanted to order 20 mins later. Then we waited another 20 for our soup, salad and cheesy bread.  The soup and bread was cold by then. I asked for a hot soup. Got told he would see if he could and if I hadn't left, I would have been probably still been waiting. Since I have diabetes and have to eat before my blood sugar drops, I ate the bread and soup.  Will NEVER come back here.
author: Kim T.

description: Pretty ok if your starving and bubba gump is packed. The pizza was probably frozen and so was the mozzarella sticks. The view was ok. The place is understaffed.
author: Amyangelbee N.

description: Pizza was crisp and flaky.   Dijon vinagrette dressing was flavorful.  Very polite staff and clean restaraunt. Vladislav our waiter was especially attentive and friendly.
author: Pat L.

description: Great great had Buffalo wings they were amazing had to get a second order got a make your own. The waiters did great and had great service from  Christian fun fast server thank you.
author: Olivia P.

description: The customer service here is the worst! Not only is the manager rude because we expected chicken Alfredo pasta not chicken Alfredo pizza. What Italian based restaurant doesn't have pastas?  He did take the pastas off our bill but made our drinks worth 5 dollars each. Do not go here
author: Caruthers C.

description: Was a great meal! Owner was very nice to us after a lady tried to cut us. Gave us free refills hastily brought us our food! Everything was handmade and you could taste the genuine in the sauce! Definitely recommend for a good slice!
author: Diggy m.

description:
SKIP IT!!! No really, don't eat here. I am definitely not what you call a picky person. I usually can find good in most things. But oh my gosh, this was pretty bad. I would like to say our waiter was very nice and good. The food was awful! 

We started with the cheesy garlic bread and Mozzarella sticks. Garlic bread was decent but the Mozzarella sticks were most definitely frozen from a box. I ordered a cup of Clam Chowder (their famous clam chowder) and nope! It was not creamy like it says in the menu. It was like cloudy clam broth with very little clams and potato. Then I got my Shrimp Scampi and nope!!! The pasta was way undercooked and the shrimp looked basic (maybe from a box also) and way over seasoned. This place has no idea how to cook Italian food. Their name is very misleading. I will never come here again. They are in a very good location, I'm sure that is the only reason they are still in business. Also, the bathrooms need A LOT more attention. They were kinda gross.
author: Jen G.

description: Awesome place to eat best clam chowder I've every had.   Great meat lovers pizza and hot wings.   Our server Vladislav was awesome.   If your near pier 39 this is a spot is recommend.
author: Eddie G.

description: Wonderful service provided by Vladislav. The pizza was very authentic. First time in San Francisco in years and glad we stopped at Luigis Pizza for dinner.
author: Danielle B.

description: I live about 25 miles from the city and every time I have company in town, I love playing tourist! One of our favorite things to do is go to pier 39. Pier 39 has a ton of food options but I LOVE pizza so we always end up here. Im always hesitant because I didn't feel like it was ran as good as it could be. I'm a people watcher and also in management so I have always paid attention to how this place operates. Let's just say, each time before, it was just for the pizza. But this last time, I could tell something had changed! And for the better! The staff was fantastic, the service was great, and the pizza was even better than its ever been! I was telling my sister that something had to of changed. Sure enough, something had. The new general manager, Vladislav, came to our table and introduced himself. I've never seen that place ran so well! The wait staff customer service was really good, we felt like royalty the way they were so attentive!!! I will no longer be hesitant! Great job Vladislav!!!
author: Angie H.

description:
Dangit!!!!!!   I have to give a star?  Pretend  like this is no more than a HALF..This has got to be one of worse meals I've had in a long time.  Our last night in San Francisco and wanted italian food, everywhere was packed, at least an hour plus wait...so we ended up here.
Nevermind the bathroom being the most disgusting thing I've ever seen...the food was no better...  Clam chowder tasted like blended chicken noodle soup and same consistancy, Shrimp fettuccine, no sauce, with hard noodles and looked like canned shrimp... Advertising Best Coffee on a chilly night on the wharf, with no coffee pot....What  the!!....
Figured out why they don't care and remain open...everywhere else so crowded and cold outside waiting, they automatically know they're getting the overflow.....what a sad sad place....
author: Carice H.

description: This was My first time here and the impressions that were made was not the best. They had unclean silver wear and the attendance of the staff was very limited. They never even came around to see if we were doing well.
author: Austin S.

description: If you like wasting time, eating bad pizza and being ripped off, come here. When our pizza finally arrived, the sundried tomatoes were burnt black, but we had waited so long we didn't want to send it back. The crust was tasteless and the sauce was almost non-existent. Paying their outrageous prices just added salt to the wound. Run away!
author: Kristin H.

description:
There were swarms of tourists at Pier 39 during lunch time and we wanted to escape.  Luigi's Pizza was on the second floor of the plaza away from the hubbub so that's where we went for a bite to eat.

We were seated in a booth that overlooked the bay.  Below, a sea lion was sunning itself on the pier and the open window let us enjoy periodic sea breezes.  Almost every other table in the place was occupied; many had been pushed together to accommodate large groups.  I got the impression that the other diners were all tourists too.

Everyone in our party ordered six slice individual pizzas with our favorite toppings.  Cheese for the picky eater, artichokes/olives/peppers for the veggie lover, ground beef/chicken for the meat lover and chicken/spinach/feta for me.  

We all appreciated being able to get exactly what we wanted.  The toppings were generous with decent coverage of cheese, meats and veggies across the pie.  But the sauce was flavorless and the crust tasted like an unsalted top saltine cracker.  It wasn't thin crust but it wasn't thick enough to be deep dish either.  

If you're in Pier 39 and don't want to leave for lunch, you can find pizza at Luigi's.  Nothing to write home about but it gets the job done.
author: Andrea T.

description:
The wait to be seated was ridiculously long. They had two servers also doing bus boy and host duties. With only a quarter of the tables filled, it took fifteen minutes for us to be seated, and another fifteen to get drinks and orders taken. Thirty minutes later, we were served our food. I had the first pizza on the menu, and it was acceptable. Their plan may be to make you wait till your so hungry that good tastes great... Prices are in line with other tourist trap vendors. I do not suggest eating here, or any other restaurant on Pier 39.

One last note, their tables are not cleaned regularly. We were seated at a dirty table.
author: R H.

description: Vladislav is the best server!!! 5 stars for him! He got our orders in quickly and go the kids food out first, which is extremely important!!!
author: Priscilla H.

description: Luigis is one of my Sam Francisco staples; a restaurant I know I can always go to and will enjoy. I've yet to dislike anything on the menu and between my boyfriend and I, we've tried nearly everything. Service is kind of hit or miss, its always pleasant but not always super friendly or attentive. Would definitely recommend for a quick lunch on the Pier
author: Sarah C.

description: I went here with some of my colleagues yesterday and our waiter rjay was awesome. Constantly checking in on us, not an empty cup, and even was able to give us some ideas of what my colleagues and I could do afterwards. He made our experience worth it and the food was great. I had the shrimp linguini and I highly suggest getting the Luigis specialty pizza. Definetly coming back with everyone
author: Christian M.

description: Blah, blah food. Just another pasta place and pizza. Nothing great would definitely not recommend. The menu is not that big so you would think they would focus on the flavors of the dishes. Not the case. Keep walking past.
author: Michelle S.

description: Luigi's Favorite Pizza was delicious and the mozzarella sticks as well. The service was quick and the workers were very polite and professional. Rjay was very quick with our requests and gave us great customer service :) definitely going back to eat here!
author: Christina L.

description: Pier 39 can be quiet overwhelming with loads of people wandering around, so it can get complicated when choosing where you'd want to eat (at least in my experience). I think Luigi's is a safe choice when with a group of friends and family. Tables are spacious, the view is great, and the quality is good. I ordered a medium veggie pizza with vegan cheese, and I was sooo stuffed. My only complaint would be time and price, but that's expected when dinning in touristy areas.
author: Livnelly M.

description: When I get home from a trip, the last thing I want to think about is how I was charged later for the whole meal when I got a receipt there that said I only paid what I wrote down. Is there a reason for this? Because this is very unprofessional. The server, Nenad, said he understood and even gave me a receipt that split the bill correctly. The pizza honestly was not worth more than 15 dollars and this headache is not worth the meal we had there. Would not recommend this restaurant, but instead to pack a lunch if visiting the Pier 39 in San Francisco.
author: Elizabeth E.

description: Was looking for some pasta and was a busy Saturday night on the pier there was no line but lots of people inside enjoying there meals which looked good for what I could see the hosted came up grabbed two menus we followed him two the table he literally tossed the menus on the tables said here n walked away we waited ten minutes looking through a small menus and not once had someone come to us and asked us if we needed anything not even water was very upset I used there one stall restroom and it was so dirty puddles on the floor no toilet paper it was very dirty for a restaurant
author: Kaylee T.

description:
We got a medium pizza with mushrooms, black olives, and fresh tomatoes with a side of fries. I usually go for a thick crust, so I was pretty nervous about going here. However, the pizza itself was pretty good. Not spectacular, but no regrets here. My only gripe with it was that they put a ton of olives and just a few mushrooms. The marinara sauce could also use some improvement, but those are minor things.. The fries were great, not at all soggy or limpy. They weren't very salted, but I prefer that. 

The place itself is also pretty good. The wait to get seated was about 15 minutes. One of my friends has this way of speaking that makes him seem really rude, but the employees remained really polite and helpful. We loved this place! Don't listen to the bad reviews unless you're terribly picky...
author: Lyra P.

description: Luigi's is a great location! We had the pizza only, and it was ok. The service was exceptional: our server was Vladislav, and he was very courteous and hospitable. I hear the clam chowder is great!
author: Andrea A.

description: I have eaten at this place many times, and the service is great. The staff and management are awesome when it comes to customer service. I would recommend this place to many who come visit the SF area.
author: Mario M.

description: Vladislav and the rest of the staff has given me A-class customer service. I highly recommend coming here especially for people out of town!
author: Jay D.

description: Its my top 3 favorite places  in SF, the pizza is a killer, great service... Love the ambiance as well! Thank you for having us! See you soon!
author: Mustafa M.

description: Great pizza and awesome view of Bay Bridge, Coit Tower, etc. service was awesome as was Vladislav our waiter, great guy. We ordered 1/2 all meat & 1/2 bacon with cheese. Thin crust and delicious. One way you know you're about to get great pizza is when they bring you refrigerated Parmesan cheese in the glass container. We will definitely have Luigi's in the future.
author: Chris D.

description:
People working here are least bothered about the customers. 
Worst experience at the first time and never again visiting this place
author: Shiva P.

description:
We were at Pier 39 so that the small humans could "hunt" for Pokemon. Since it was their day, I let them choose the restaurant for lunch. Of course, they selected pizza so this is where we ended up. The gal seating folks was terrible. She had a frown on her face, was unkempt, and extremely rude. When we were finally seated, we were greeted by our server who was just a notch better than the other employee we encountered. Clearly, service is not their strength.

Well, food was no better. Pizza tasted like Costco pizza but a notch below. The garlic bread was almost $10 and it was half a very small loaf - the photo makes it look big but it was really not. The chowder was barely hot and tasted canned. The pasta with pesto was over cooked with what seemed to be store bought sauce just thrown on top. 

To top the experience off, the booth where we were sitting smelled like vomit. I would have asked to switch tables but by then it was almost 3pm and we had already waited close to 45 minutes for a table.

This was my first and last time at this place.
author: Lina L.

description:
The first thing that went wrong was when the server gave our table away to another couple even though we came on the first call.  The server called out our name and we heard him on the first call and headed to him, but another couple stepped up and took our spot (f*** them) and the idiot server took them away even though he HAD JUST SEEN US 5 MINUTES AGO and we were one of the only people waiting for a table so there's no excuse for forgetting our faces.  When he came back he realized his mistake, but did not apologize.  When we were seated, I could tell that this table was typically not used to serve guests.  He sat us in the corner where there was no one else, the sun was beating down on our faces to the point where we were squinting and uncomfortable, there were no napkins, salt & pepper shakers or red pepper flakes.  After 15 minutes we had to flag down a waitress to take our order since we were seated away from everyone else.  We asked if we could do half/half for one large pizza and she said yes.  She failed to mention there is an extra charge of $3.50 per flavor so it was an additional $7 just because we wanted two flavors on one pizza.  Ridiculously overpriced and shady of her to not to tell us.  The bill came out to be $38.53 for 1 large pizza with 2 flavors, and 1 coke.  The chicken alfredo was pretty much all sauce, there were barely any pieces of chicken and tomato.  The combo flavor had sparse toppings as well.  We both walked out still hungry and irritated.  Worst pizza ever!!!! 

TLDR:
Service: 1/5 SHADY waitress and IDIOT server
Food: 2/5 (sparse toppings, pretty much all sauce and dough)
author: Sabrina T.

description:
Atmosphere: I mean the view of the Bay is amazing, and it has a solid location.

Food: Not the best. None of us really liked our pizzas and I felt it was missing cheese. Not pleased and expected better. 

Service: Meh.
author: Michelle W.

description: Mark was our waiter today, & he was amazing! He had such a great attitude towards us even though we were a party of eight. If you come here, definitely recommend asking for him! Also, the food was amazing! Our pizza was fresh out the oven & they brought our food fast! Great time, we will definitely come again.
author: Sheenal S.

description:
Came here for the GF pizza. GF crust-vegan cheese or lactose free cheese. Meats? Nothing is GF. Why would you have all of these options and not 1 topping. Oh well. Dinner salad it is. Was good. Wife had clam chowder that was awful. Sorry guys you need to do some work. 

Server was very nice and honest. She was the only saving grace.
author: Jim M.

description: Best pizza and tortellini I've had in my life, waiters are awesome and commodore your needs very cool Italian vibe and great views. Vladislav is hands down the coolest waiter I've had in from LA willing to come back to SF just for this place alone. I'm a big fan of chicken Alfredo but the tortellini was a much better substitute.
author: Rafael T.

description: By far one of the worst guest service restaurants i have been to. It was pretty slow when me and my 5 friends went in, and still they couldn't keep up. We ordered our appetizers fine, and they came out in a decent time, but after that it went all downhill. The server NEVER came back to finish our order, and never came to check on us until we had to wave him down. After finally ordering, we waited over 30 minutes without getting our food. My friend ordered calamari that NEVER arrived. And in that 30 minutes we waited to get our food, we were never approached by our waiter on any updates or anyone checking in on us. The waiter seemed to be really stressed, which i understand at first due to working in a restaurant as a Supervisor. But it seemed like he was avoiding the dining area due to him knowing how much of a shit hole this place was.  Every 5-10 minutes a table would get up and just leave after receiving their drinks, or not getting anything at all due to them taking so long with everything. We watched around 5-6 tables of people get up and leave.  After waiting too long for food, we tell the waiter that we want to cancel our order and just pay for the drinks we got, and leave. Then he tells us he's gonna go check on our food and magically brings out all 5 dishes.  After arguing with what seemed to be the manager, he told us we were rude for putting our hand up in the air to get their attention, which was the only way to do so since they NEVER came to our table to check on us. But we still called them over in a polite way. One of my friends ended up walking out because his food took so long, and they still tried to force us to pay for our friends food, and told us that it was our fault and we need to pay or they will call the cops.  Note that my friend left wayyy before our food arrived, so it's not like he ate anything off the plate.  Just hands down terrible service. I know they were understaffed, which was obvious, since the two waiters were acting as hosts, servers, waiters, bus boys, and pouring the alcohol at the bar themselves which is why i was trying to be patient with them since i know they were struggling. But they still could have done their best with communicating to their customers that it might be a little long wait for food, and AT LEAST check in on us every now and then, but they never did any of that.
author: Jake J.

description: Got forgotten about after we sat. Then brought drinks, sprite was flat, spit it back in my glass, no biggie. Took my glass away, the dishwasher at the server station used a new straw to sample my soda to validate it was flat. That's like me spitting in his mouth. The host asked me if everything was okay, so I told him what I saw. He immediately went to confront the guy who sampled my drink. He comes back and assured me he didn't do it. I saw him, literally 5 feet away from me. He said he would check the camera. At that point I was offended he would even challenge me and make a scene. He then got the dishwasher to come to the table to tell me I was wrong. We just left, so awkward and disturbing, completely grossed out
author: Sarah T.

description:
3.5 stars.  Due to it's location at Pier 39 w/ a nice view, it's a little overpriced, but the food wasn't too bad.  We had a Luigi's Favorite pizza and the tortellini.  Yes, this $50 dinner beat the taste of our $130 dinner from the previous night at this fanicer restaurant by a landslide in the same area.  I loved the seating arragement of the place.  People aren't sitting on top of each other and we had just as good if not a better view than last night's restuarant.  

It's a nice, casual place.  The food isn't spectacular, but it tastes good enough to say you've had a good meal.  Again, could have been about $10-15 cheaper.  My small-sized pizza alone was $18.  That's what I pay for a large, gourmet pizza at Round Table, which by the way, tastes awesome.
author: Rolena I.

description: I dont know what happened to the manager of this place but the new one sucks. Lack of communication, so fake when he approaches you, too busy trying to make his money rather than care about customers.
author: Hannah J.

description: Great place , excellent view :) very good and big portions of food . Manager Slav was super friendly and helpful to his guests . I will come back again for sure.
author: Meggie D.

description: If you are hungry and want pizza. Don't go here. Burnt Pizza. And Baaaaad spaghethi and meatballs. Meat balls taste like dog food. And I've tried it !!!
author: Ia C.

description: Great service! The pizza was good and the service great. It was nice that we didn't have to wait a long time and they were very accommodating to our little ones.
author: Lisa W.

description: Bay bridge views.What a great place to grab a bite!The manager there was so nice he welcomed us sat us on a table. The pasta primavera was delicious.The server was so friendly. I wish I had a picture of the food before we inhaled it all. BBQ pizza amazing mozzarella sticks delicious,Caesar salad yummy .The new management is great thank you so much guys fro welcome us on Saturday night 8 people don't go to Bubba Gump go to Luigi's definitely I will back with my all family.... Great job .. amazing service.Good experience.
author: Angel V.

description: Our straws were filled with dust inside. The service was super slow. Pizza tasted horrible. Do not come here.
author: Am T.

description: Service is slow - waited for almost an hour when the restaurant is half full. Seems they forgot to place my order - which happens - but my waiter didn't bother to check in on me which would have solved the problem. Someone who wasn't even my waiter finally brought my food - after I asked about it twice.  The manager comped the pizza and salad  which I appreciate (which is why I changed the rating to 3 stars versus 1) but I am not looking for free food. I want quality service. Pizza is so so.
author: Gwyn K.

description: So great! Best Alfredo pizza I've ever had, so creamy!!! Great service. All around 10/10.
author: Summer N.

description: A tourist trap. Nothing is good here except for the convenient location. Ingredients are not fresh, portions are small, execution is poor.
author: Edward S.

description: The service was very good and the food came out very fast. I was apprehensive at first because of the negative reviews, but the food was very good and worth the money. The chicken parmesan was the best in my opinion, but the lasagna and tortellini was good as well.
author: Alex Y.

description: The pizza wasn't good, I'd dare say Digiornos  is better. The host and waiters lack customer service. We have 8 month old and we asked for ranch and they slid it in front of her , utensils in front   of her no common sense. We tried it wasn't good we won't be coming back.
author: Beckah G.

description: Good food,  very expensive for a pizza place! There is an additional 5.5% surcharge after taxes,so beware
author: Yamile P.

description: We were pleasantly surprised by this restaurant!  The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. My Chicken Parmesan, served with spaghetti and Italian bread was wonderful. Nadia, our server, was courteous in spite of it being very busy. The General Manager, Vlad, also check in with us.  Very enjoyable.....we will return!
author: Sandy C.

description: So my friends and I went to the restaurant and ordered a LARGE chicken BBQ pizza for $26.99. However, when the waiter came to give the pizza, it was only eight slices (a large having ten). When I told him later on, he said (AND QUOTE) "Oh, it's a large they just cut it weirdly." But the chicken was good. Also when we wanted to get the check, the waiter looked as us and walked away. Never eat here again
author: Elliot F.

description: Best wings I've ever had, pizza was pretty good as well! Christian made our experience here very welcoming. Great job by him and the cooks. Good food and service! Definitely would come back just for the wings!
author: Rudy L.

description: The staff was incredibly attentive.  The food was hot and delicious- we had a pizza and the shrimp scampi.  Both were super flavorful.  Our table gave us a great view of the bay bridge and the nighttime light show.  I would recommend!!!!
author: Scott W.

description: Visited Luigi's on 3/3/18, my wife and daughter each had a cup of clam chowder and my son and I split a medium pizza, plus I had a couple of beers. The GM Vladislav, greeted us right away and were seated. Our server Christian was courteous and had our drinks and food ordered quickly. The entire staff that was working that night were extremely polite, friendly and made our dining experience very nice. I would highly recommend the restaurant to anyone visiting the area.
author: Greg D.

description: Decided to try out Luigi's and should of read the reviews before coming in to eat. Wasn't busy and we waited in the front for 10 minutes before being seated. Pizza was alright but tasted like a frozen pizza our server valdislav our server did a terrible job and didn't want to split the check. But that wasn't even the worst part of the night the mice's running around while we were eating disgusted us and will not be eating here! Terrible just terrible
author: Casey G.

description: Vladislav is the best! His customer service is impecable, he satisfied all our needs to the fullest. Very nice and attentive. The pizza and wings are also great.
author: Denisse M.

description: always come here when I'm near the pier, good prices and even better service! Vladislav is very kind and makes sure to check up on the customers
author: Perie R.

description: Zero stars.... Valerie is the rudest hostess ever. We stood at the door waiting for 15 minute and everyone working here saw us waiting for someone to help us. keep in mind; there was no wait whatsoever. They all looked at us and continue to ignore us. So we asked for help and they said someone will help and walk away. After 35 minute Valerie finally decides to tell us that we can't dine here and eat because kitchen is closed so we can only order to go. Freaking ridiculous. Even people had to get up to ask waiters to order their food. Don't come here, with such crappy service! Waste of money and time. They need better workers and better customer service.
author: Monica T.

description: Great food and excellent service! Vladislav, the manager is personable and warm! Definitely a good place to get homemade Italian goodness!
author: Arielle M.

description: Awesome spot to grab some food and a drink! Had their wings and pizza and it was delicious! Great service and food! Also has a gorgeous view of the bay, with tables surrounded by big windows! Would highly recommend this place!!
author: Sabrina H.

description: I was at pier 39 and I was craving some Italian food. I decided to try this place out. I had the Luigis choice personal pizza. I really enjoyed the pizza although I feel it is too overpriced. I understand it's located on at a touristic location but I ended up spending $30 for the pizza , a coke and a small salad. That's just seems a little bit too much for what I got in return. That is why I'm giving this place four stars. The food is good but nothing memorable. I still feel Broco Billy's Pizza in fremont CA  is hard to beat. But Luigis was a pretty decent place to sit Down and enjoy a good slice of pizza. On the other hand I do not think I would be willing to drive more than five minutes to reach a Luigis location. Broco Billy's pizza on in comparison I would drive 30 minutes to get to if I had to. The service was good and the location is nice but too expensive for what you will receive in return.
author: Sergio Jr P.

description: Waited about 15 min for a party of 2. After we got sat, we waited another 10-15 min of all the servers ignoring us until my bf had to ask the busser to get us waters and beers. The restaurant is very noisy, especially with the kitchen blasting their music, so we checked to see if we could sit at the bar but they said they were closing soon. After we got drinks, we asked if we could order. The busser (who had to help us because I guess our server was ignoring us and couldn't handle his section 3 or 4 table section) then told us the kitchen was only making pizza. Wanted to try pasta and clam chowder but the kitchen wanted to close early. Asked for the check and only then our server came up to us and handed it to us. No apologies, no introduction, he just handed us the check. As a server, I understand how it feels to work nights and want to get off early, but I NEVER take my bad mood out on the customer. We came an hour before they closed and they treated us like we came in 5 min before they closed. My experience here was so bad, I had to leave this review. Only good thing about experience was the hardworking busser who had helped us. The food looks good but be aware that the service is extremely awful and inexperienced.
author: Sheldene M.

description: This place was awful. My family and I came here for the first time it didn't look as if all the tables were full. They said we would be waiting for about 5 minutes we stepped to the side and waited for 25 minutes after we realized how many people they let in before us we went a ask how many more minutes because they said 5 but we understand it's a restaurant maybe they mis calculated the wait time. They told us we would have to wait for 45 more minutes . WHAT!!! I spoke to the person who wrote my name down and he said someone had crossed our name off the list . Quickly after he sat us down on a table that had been available since we got there. The food was okay but all the cheese and toppings fell off the pizza as soon as I lifted it so I'm assuming it wasn't fully cooked. The hygiene in this place isn't the best either . We got our bill and realized they automatically charges the tip on there which sometimes I don't mind that but the tip is half your check bill something isn't right I asked them to take it off and I would leave the tip in cash they said okay. Today after a few days of visiting this place I realized the tip was charged on my card plus the tip I left on the table. This is a place I would not recommend going.
author: Jas E.

description:
I'm giving one star for the decent food. Everything else sucked. Took a long time to even get acknowledged by any worker to get seated. Before we were seated a male employee who clearly saw us waiting at the front expressed joy in LEAVING and didn't even bother to ask if we needed help. He clearly didn't like his job or just had a bad day since he couldn't wait to leave and shout it out to everyone in the restaurant. 

After finally getting seated by who we believe was the hostess(who also didn't seem like she didn't want to be there) we were able to get a waiter who was much more welcoming. I really had no problem with our waiter. He genuinely seemed like a nice guy and I would have really liked him if it wasn't for everything else. After my group was eating he was quick to clean up the table. I got the clam chowder bread bowl and left the bread bowl since I like to eat it by itself. He was nice and offered to box it for me, but after he took my plate a person from my group informed me that our waiter cleaned up the table with his bare hands. I'm giving him the benefit of the doubt but I really hope that my waiter washed his hands first before handling my food. 

Leaving that thought behind our waiter comes back to our table to give our check. Our group was only a group of five yet our waiter already added an 18% to our bill. After asking him if we can split it into two he came back with the bill still with the 18% tip added to BOTH of the checks. Thinking that it was just him informing us of the overall total with tip we gave our cards to him. But as soon as we got our receipts back that is when we realized that he had charged my friend and I the total amount including the 18% tip without consulting with us if it was okay. Already irritated my friend and I just signed the receipts and agreed to never come back.
author: Junessa S.

description: The wait staff is unprepared and did not know what ricotta cheese was. Our orders were delayed or wrong, the eggplant parmigiana was underwhelming. There must be a freezer full of mozzarella sticks and chicken wings and a fridge full of salad bags. We will never return.
author: Tate B.

description: We ordered bbq pizza and pesto primavera. Both were delicious. It wasnt full so we were attended immediately by the server. Would come back.
author: hazel s.

description: Please do not come here. Hair in the pizza. So freakin gross. Can't wrap my head around it.
author: Elodie P.

description: My family and I had a window seat over looking the bay. My 10 year old daughter was looking in between our booth and the wall. She noticed rat traps. I looked and sure enough there were several rat traps, droppings including a deceased rat!! All right behind our seats and the next booth!!!
author: Marisa D.

description: We were very hungry and after a bad experience at bubba gumps we ended up here the pizza was decent  and the shrimp scampi was a bit oily with too much butter and the taste wasnt great. this is my first time at the wharf and we got charged for SF surcharge of $5 it's a bit pricey for the quality.
author: Windy C.

description: Service was great, food was decent for the price, the setup for our large party, (including children) was quick and easy. Vlad was our server and he was quick and accurate.
author: J H.

description:
This place is delicious. Service is pleasant and the pizza is bomb :) 
We came here the first day we arrived in Cali and now we're back for seconds. Chowder is very good. Second best I've had so far. Pizza is great, not greasy not thin. Sauce is lite. The pepperoni is the little ones that hold the grease in. So good! 

The decor is a bit out dated. But the view is wonderful off the pier. Our waiter for the second time is very nice!
author: Amelia L.

description: My family and I went here after a boat ride. We waited 5 minutes just to get seated. There was no line, they just didn't notice us standing there. Once we got seated, we were ignored for 15 minutes. No one even offered to bring us water. We tried to get the attention of multiple servers, but they just walked right by us. We ended up just walking out of the restaurant. Terrible service!
author: Lisa L.

description:
Pizza tasted bad and an okay service
Tried at pier 39, it is expensive and so not worth it
author: Sravya V.

description:
I have been to this location twice and both times the service has been just excellent, and so has the food.

Vladislav was consistently attentive and friendly. The pesto pizza I had this time was delicious, but he just made this meal so much more special. I loved eating here.
author: Michelle V.

description: Pizza was decent, service, well I am 3 tables away from where the servers are just hanging out. Slow refills can't get a box for take out Bill because I guess the 7 people in the nearly empty room have better things to do like clean.
author: Jason M.

description: Ended up here more because of the location and checked Yelp after we sat down. Was a little concerned when I saw the average rating. We got two medium pizzas, one cheese and one pesto-artichoke-bacon, and both were delicious. View is also nice. We were a party of four parents and three kids (3, 6, and 7), and the kids loved it too. Service was attentive and courteous.
author: Joe S.

description: Luigi's was super good! Went there with my team and the food and service was top notch! Our waiter Vladislav was very cool and always made sure we were taken care of! Keep up the great work!
author: Colton H.

description:
Horrible place.
Food taste is terrible.
Digiorno pizza is a million times better. 
Worst service.
Steer clear!
author: Znd V.

description:
This is a quick little lunch place.

Food was pretty good. My boyfriend and I ordered the pesto bacon and some mozzarella sticks. The pizza was good - a bit salty. But it had the most buttery crust ever, which was great. 

The service was great. And the food came out quick. But it was pretty hot inside. We were in a booth so we opened a window, but it did little to help the heat.

Overall, was a positive experience. Although, heads up, this places seems a bit overpriced. Bill came out to almost 50 dollars for a medium pizza and drinks for two people.
author: Rebecca S.

description: Great food and location . The scenery from the restaurant was amazing and we saw a seal swimming by the boats. Customer service wasn't as good. Our waiter was rushing, even running at one point across the room. The place wasn't that busy to even say that you were doing a lot to consider running. Few time she bummed into customers. She forgot our plates, utensils and napkins. The pizza we ordered was perfect enough for me to forget the terrible service. And once I was full and happy I realized our waiter might have been very rushed but she was nice to us the whole time too. Very mixed emotions about this place. But good pizza for sure.
author: Melissa Z.

description: Our order came out wrong, we chose to not send it back as it was just the type of sauce but our crust was burnt. The staff was clique-y and inattentive. The pizza was edible but barely so. And to top it off the music playing was full of expletives with children present in the restuarant. Would not eat here again.
author: MaCKenzie M.

description:
It's ok.  Pizza is good.  Not amazing but not paper thin like some can be here.  It's not horrid. 

The views are pretty.

The cheese is well cooked. 

Listening to a waiter talk about tips to people from somewhere in Asia is cute, but sad.  He makes it out to be a requirement.  Shameless.  Thus the two stars off.
author: Bob M.

description: Great food, ate at bar, bartender knew area well very nice place good pizza. Cold beer.
author: Tom W.

description: Excellent food & service. Our girl was great refill drinks right on time (early, before empty). Clam chowder was delicious ! & so was everything else
author: Alyssa W.

description: Small pizza place with friendly staff. Very accommodating and efficient in getting everyone seated with the busy pier 39 crowds. However, the food quality was lacking and left you wanting more. Bland is the word that comes to mind. Very overpriced as well, almost $20 for a small (10 inch) vegetarian pizza. Will not be frequenting Luigi's again.
author: Omar E.

description:
Instead of a long winded review, I will just share some bulletpoints about my experience here....so here goes..

Pros

-Food is good! Had a 1/2 cheese, 1/2 Italian Sausage Pizza and the crust was thick and the cheese gooey, freaking loved it!
- Its located in Fishermans Wharf just above Bubba Gump and wasn't too busy while we were there, so it lead to a nice, quiet meal...
- Waiter was pretty good and refileed our drinks without having to be asked

Cons

- Prices are a little steep, but this is in FW, so that can be excused
- host didn't even look at us and just asked if we wanted a table or booth, when I said "booth" he told us to pick one out and seat ourselves..(??) nice (*sarcasm*)
- those bathrooms are Nasty! as in use-your-foot-to flush nasty. ugh.gross. there was actually a plunger tipped over in the middle of the floor and TP strewn about on the floor. Clean this, will ya?? theres like 7 people in the place, you aren't too busy.
