so the food was good, service was meh...go at your own risk..

3 stars
author: Mike F.

description: Hostess refused to move us after we asked to be moved next to window with ocean view, she tried to convince us that a view of side of a building was a good view. I watched as three other people were moved to view seats after I had asked twice. We were there longer than anyone that had asked before us. Also the service is really slow and food was not that good.
author: Dan P.

description:
I just stopped by alone and I spend such a great time even I just drink coupe of lemonade. 
Thank you and thank you so much.
author: Tadami S.

description:
I ate here a few times due to other restaurants are packed and is an hour or more wait (not happening!)
Place is huge, seating for over 80 persons but is never filled 80%; with old style booth and tables; service was 50/50, didn't care to smile, came to check on my table once and only half asked and walked away; food was good but not great, it was flavorable but nothing I can't make at home. Price is a bit higher than most place but it's the pier. 
Just not impressed with them. 
Was feeling hungry today, so I called in to order, phone rang around 5 times before I hung up, called again 3 mins later and they hung up on me. 
Wow.
author: Fiona B.

description: This place sucks. The host was running all over the restaurant bussing tables, bringing people drinks, seating people, taking customers bills etc. They are way understaffed and unorganized. To top that off, the service is awful and the food is worse. If you're in the area, please do yourself a favor and spend your time and money else where.
author: Annie B.

description: Food was very bland. Waiter was very rude did not want to split the bill according to what each individual ordered in my group. He said he didn't want to do it, he was to busy. To make things worse, he then demanded a very generous tip that we didn't feel he was entitled to. So, we denied his request. He then threatened to call security for not giving him a tip! We then stood our ground and advised him to do so, since we weren't in the wrong. I mean, it wasn't like we weren't going to pay for our meals. We just didn't feel he was entitle to such a huge amount of a tip. Maybe if he wasn't rude and demanding he might had received a reasonable tip from us. NEVER GOING HERE AGAIN!
author: Alej Q.

description: Yuck!  The 2 stars is only for the view.  Pizza tastes like any frozen one you can get at a grocery store.  Was also never offered a drink refill.  Do not recommended.
author: Michelle W.

description: Service was fast which is very important: got 4 kids in tow! Slav anticipated our needs as the kids were patiently waiting for their pizza. We were not at all hurried when we finished. Pizza was all gone: that good
author: Kyrienne M.

description: The pizza was great! The service was absolutely crap. Literally only 3 tables and still couldn't get a refill. The hostess made it seem like a chore to seat us. Was very disappointed in the staff. That is all.
author: Lindsay R.

description:
We went for lunch today and we were pretty nervous as the place was empty and definitely needed a good cleaning but, to our surprise, the food was tasty! There were 7 of us and the pizza was good, Pesto pasta, chicken parm, and a slice of pepperoni pizza. 
The service was "ok" we separated our checks, they added 15% gratuity to each check. Not the best, not the worst.
author: Holly C.

description:
It was okay but they played me when they charged us for 6 people although we all got separate checks AND THERE SOUP WAS ONLY 2 spoons 
Don't try and play me thank you very much
 WHAT IF I DIDNT WANNA TIP 

PS their silverware was not even clean our server even noticed and said "oh sorry he's new" referring to our first server.... Food good customer service not that great..

BTW THEY DONT ID IF YOU WANT ALCOHOL/BEER i could've been 16 for all they know.
author: Diego D.

description:
I went here on 2-6-16 I was in SF for the super bowl so I decided to grab some pizza

BEST experience 

There food is delicious and there service is great they were quick the food was hot and our server Vice and Tony were so polite 

I'd definitely come back here again
author: Michelle S.

description:
First the food -
The appetizer we ordered - garlic bread - was served cold.
The chicken wings were warm too at best.
The service was the worst I've seen in recent times at a restaurant.
The pasta arrived about 40 minutes after we placed the order and this was at a time when there about 5 tables occupied(fairly empty restaurant). The waitress was also plain rude. She 
a) forgot our order - our pasta came about 20 minutes after we reminded her. When asked about the delay , she said "there was a mixup in the kitchen" with an indifferent expression.
b) dropped off my friend's credit card at a different table and argued with us saying she gave it to us when we asked about it!
Never ever coming back.
author: Kavya R.

description:
Excellent gluten free pizza!  Mert was our server tonight. He was very helpful. 

I really liked my salad and the pizza was astounding!  Lots of toppings, lots of cheese. The gluten free pizza comes in medium size. It was more than enough for two of us. I'd also add that I found them very reasonably priced.
author: Amy H.

description: Fantastic meal from start to finish.  Thanks Vladislav for make our visit so memorable.
author: Margie B.

description: Their wings are good but the pizza was mediocre. Hostess was struggling to seat 4 parties when the place was practically empty by noon. It was a long wait to be seated and a long wait for the pizza. I had the treasure Island pizza with my brother and it was nothing special. The server did an excellent job and made rounds to check up on us often. Prices are steep for what you get but expected of food in SF.
author: Nhan L.

description: Hello came here first time very slow paced servers when there was no other customers only a few they should move faster guy server had music from his phone playing the music would stop every minute when a text came through he would text and you can hear him typing very annoying for a restaurant unprofessional servers !!!
author: Megan W.

description:
The food was delicious, but its the staff thats the problem with this resteraunt. My family and i were not greeted when walking in, just stared at by a member of the staff until she eventually said "just pick a seat" 
Once seated, besides giving us our food or taking our order, we werent once checked on. Then when given the reciept for the bill there was no "thanks have a good day" or anything she just handed the bill over and walked away.
author: Allison S.

description:
The pizza was alright.... we ordered a large pizza which wasn't so large. I mean c'mon really? Ugh

And our waiter did not smile once he just slammed our plates and waters on the table. It looked like he was definitely having a rough day. The flavors and restaurant were nothing spectacular very mediocre restaurant. Just stay away not worth the money. The view is nice hence the 2nd star rating.
author: Grace G.

description: Deserves a solid 3.5 to 4 stars. A good, but not great pizza. Service was excellent and they really were helpful in our decision. They had a good selection of beers and the view is great. Overall, it was a good deal, especially for the area. Most places are much more expensive for crap food, abs even worse service.
author: C. J.

description:
Sent pizza back twice, wow really???
But it was good when we got it. 
I will not get it again.
author: Mike R.

description:
This place is horrendous.  The menu is sub par with not many options. After ordering a cheese pizza, I watched a filthy waiter use his bare hands to wipe the water off our silverware that was obviously just taken out of the dishwasher.  We had another waitress bring us different silverware.  The same waiter also brought my house salad with his dirty hands touching the lettuce. Needless to say I didn't eat anything. 

My wife ordered the Pazzan-something salad. When it came she was disgusted with the taste and only had one bite.  My buddy ordered the Eggplant Parmesan.  He described it as "garbage" filled with wretched marinara sauce.  

The atmosphere was hot and musty. I will never go to this nasty place again.  The women's bathroom was so disgusting my mistress refused to go potter.
author: Steve H.

description:
This isn't an upscale place whatsoever... it's super causal to the T. 

Don't order the calamari; you can get fresher and tastier options along the pier and wharf. 

Boneless hot waannnggs are worth skipping completely. 

The combination pizza is good, but I'm not in love. 

The service sucks. The hostess didn't greet us nor did she inform us of the wait time after she finally took our name down. Our female server (I never caught her name) was snobby. The servers there don't work; all they do is take our drink and food orders and let everybody else pick up their slack. The only people who were working hard were the table and food bussers.
author: Dianne F.

description: We were here to have our lunch and had the most disastrous vegetarian pizza ever. The crust was not cooked and there was a lot of cheese in it.I wish I had tried any other restaurants near by. And the service was also below par. Should have stayed away by looking at the other reviews!
author: Sukirti S.

description:
I usually have Yelp open BEFORE I step into a new restaurant, just to see what other Yelpers think about it and..just in case it's a place I should avoid going to. However, this time I was with my uncle, younger brother and cousin. They were visiting from LA and my uncle wanted to check out Pier 39. The two youngsters were complaining and complaining that they were hungry/dying and demanded pizza and/or pasta. So, we were walking down pier 39 with the rows and rows of shops/restaurants and saw the sign for Luigi's Pizzeria. So, we walked in and I got my phone out to check in. I was pretty shocked to see the 2.5 stars! I didn't want to say anything out loud but I was thinking.. man, we didn't make the best choice of eating here for lunch. 

All of that aside though, we walked in and the lady in the front kindly led us to our booth table (which I was so happy to have). It was right next to the water and view of the bay bridge with all the yachts!! They had a salad bar (which I was unsure whether it was free or not..should've asked), nice "pizza place" decoration, which might make sense only in my head. They had cute Christmas decorations as well! 

You can order the pizza on their menu, or create your own. I think the mini is a good size for one person, because I was stuffffed afterwards. I ordered the Vegetarian pizza. The waiter wasn't too friendly; he just got his work done, as in he took our orders without a smile on his face. It didn't bug me too much though because all I was thinking about was the food!! 

The wait was incredibly long.. It literally felt like forever until our orders came out. I read some of the reviews and was really scared to take my first bite into the pizza. Would it be cold because it was "frozen"?! However, all four of us enjoyed our pizza. I even ate the crust, which says something because I never eat my crust. It had a nice semi-salty flavor that tasted really good if I bit into it with some of the topping/cheese part. :) I probably shouldn't have even finished my pizza because we were having crab for dinner that night, but I just wanted to finish everything. 

I'll admit, it's not the best pizza I've eaten, but it was still pretty darn good!
author: Christine Y.

description: Visited for the first time a couple of weeks ago and was amazed by the customer service shown by Slav. He was not even our server yet took his time to come and make sure everything was perfect. The food was amazing as well and priced great. Will be back again because of him.
author: Patricia A.

description: Went here in July for a family trip, was looking for a pizza place since that was the only thing my daughter likes. This was the right place choose, excellent view of the bay.  The pizza was good and not too pricey.
author: Lolita M.

description: First and last time here. Horrible service, waitress took our order and didn't see her for about 25 minutes. Place wasn't even packed. Pizza was good and that's about it.
author: Dora G.

description: I was looking forward to a nice meal, but it was the complete opposite of that. The service was really bad. We had to wait 15 minutes to even be asked what we wanted to drink. Then the wait staff took another 10 minutes to take our order. The food was a bit expensive, and not all that great. I definitely recommend you eat somewhere else if you plan on visiting San Francisco.
author: Angelica S.

description: Literally don't bother, it's a pizzeria and the pizza was awful, which makes no sense. Service was good though.
author: David K.

description: My group and I were headed to Bubba Gump when we decided to try this little spot instead. We should've stuck with Bubba Gump. Everything tasted like they took it from the freezer and reheated it. Pizza was still cold in some spots, shrimp scampi was dry, tasteless.  Not a good experience.
author: liza a.

description: Just meh. The clam chowder was oily and low on flavor.  No one in my group was very impressed.
author: Tim S.

description: Vladislav was our server. Excellent service. Good food. We ordered the Lasagna Bolognese, chicken wings, pizza with pesto, bacon and artichokes. Yum
author: Gizelle A.

description:
Very average food. 

We started by ordering wings, which they were out of (boneless and regular) as well as raspberry ice tea which they were also out of. The food was okay, probably should've taken the hint when we had no wait and got a seat with a view.

If you're just going for the ambiance and a view of Alcatraz then it's alright, but if you're going for food quality then id probably recommend trying somewhere else.

Also the men's bathroom was disgusting. Water (I'm hoping) covered the floor and it's a single room so you will have to wait.
author: Matthew S.

description: Great with kids. They loved pizza. I had panzanella salad and it was good although I am used to more bread croutons.
author: Saff E.

description: It's ok. I mean the pizza is ok, the food is ok, but the service is no good. I honestly didn't even know who my waiter was.
author: Andres O.

description:
HORRIBLE SERVICE AND TASTE. I would never be there anymore if I have another chance to be at San Francisco.
There was one guy who help us, and Idk his name but he was black with short hair.
No smile, and doing some shit without bringin checks or whatever, if there's boss they better freakin teach him what does customer service means
author: Kiseuk A.

description: Awesome service!  Our waiter provided me with an amazing off menu meal that was Whole30 compliant. He handled a large group of teens and just made it  perfect evening!
author: Kathie S.

description: Wow This place take there time to make food but as soon you tease amazing you can feel the passion of the chief work just to top it off great customer service. Great view!
author: Humberto C.

description: My visit to San Francisco with my children was topped off with a visit to Luigi's.  The pizza was good but our server Vladislav made the experience even better. Great service, he was prompt, attentive and friendly. Customer service is important to me and my family when we go out and we felt welcomed and appreciated. Thanks Vladislav.
author: Christopher A.

description:
We came in because the wait at Bubba Gump's was off the hook and we were with people who wanted to eat there. So, we decided instead of waiting in the freezing winds of Pier 39 that we should stop in for a snack...and perhaps a beer. We were seated at the bar and ordered 2 beers and calamari. The calamari was delicious. It wasn't tough or chewy, the consistency was perfect. The flavor of it was delicious without being too salty. The beer selection was ok. The standard domestics and a couple of local crafts. 

The service was good. We were checked on without being stalked. I'm not in SF too much, and especially not Pier 39, but I'd revisit this place for a meal if I were local.
author: Temenah C.

description: This place is the best, Thaddeus the manager came to the table and greeted is kindly and the server vladisver (I probably spelled it wrong) was a great server, small error with our check but nothing that couldn't be fixed.also the food was GREAT
author: Kiana L.

description: I'm not going to go on and on about how clean the bathrooms are or what a nice location they have on the second floor at the Pier 39 shopping center... or about the decor.  All I have to say is that i've had better $40 dollar medium pizza!  boo for the price and the quality EVEN though i should have expected it since it is SFO.  It's pretty sad when not even my toddler liked their pizza... i mean, what kid doesn't love pizza! Thanks but no thanks.
author: Lina H.

description:
HORRIBLE SERVICE! It took 10-15 minutes to get menus (sign said to seat ourselves). Drinks didn't come for a while but the kids pizza didn't even come when we were about half way thru our late lunch!!! 
Yes I understand that's it's a busy holiday weekend but we asked 3 servers for the kids pizza to no avail!! Water was never refilled, thru our entire meal. 
The food was good and the manager (whose response was they were short staffed & he was new) gave us a generous discount on our meal. If they don't get it together, they will not make it much longer.
author: Sophia O.

description: Was fairly empty for dinner time on the wharf, where everywhere else was an hour wait. Crappy service, mediocre pizza, don't bother unless starved!
author: Angela P.

description: Was a little skeptical about this place when we walked in but figured to give it a try...after waiting 10min for someone to finally approach the hostess desk we were seated. We then were greated by Omar with a nice smile and very polite. He attended us well and nailed our order down. Overall pricing of the food is expensive for the taste but after all it is on the pier. Nice spot to get some pizza wings and cheesesticks
author: Will H.

description:
My girlfriend and I went for a stroll along the Embarcadero and worked up an appetite. We decided on Italian and since we wanted to try something that we haven't had before, we stumbled upon this place.

Unfortunately we never made it into the restaurant. Basically we stood at the front of house podium with no one to greet us. After about 20 minutes of waiting to put our names down for a table and watching the understaffed workers struggling to tend to the impatient patrons already sitting at a table, we decided to head elsewhere. 

As we turned around, I noticed a pretty long line of people waiting to get their names on the list and a large crowd watching the show that just started behind the carousel. We ended up watching the show and stayed till the end of that to let the crowd dissipate so we don't have to walk back through the sea of people. 

Half an hour passed and the show ended, the crowd thinned out and we decided to head out to another restaurant. As we passed this place, I noticed there was still no one at the front podium to greet guests and the couple behind us earlier were still waiting. Kudos to them for waiting an additional 30 minutes. I hope they got a table and had decent service.
author: Ben D.

description: Pasta was excellent and most importantly our waiter victor was amazing.  Recommend the pasta primavera and tortellini.  Kids love the cheesy garlic bread and Pizza
author: Shaji S.

description:
Oh, Luigi's.....if I could rate on taste alone, you'd get 4/5 stars....

But....

Service was poor.  Our host gets an A, our server a C, and whoever is responsible for forgetting to make our order entirely (yes, you read that right) gets an F for sure.

Husband ordered a unique create your own mini pizza and it was fabulous.. when he got it.

I had the Panzanella salad add chicken and it was AMAZING... when I got it.

Shame on the waitress for not realizing (or caring?) that she served many, many tables between received our order and finally checking to see where our food was.  And shame on the cook(s) who were more concerned with perfecting their later-that-night Halloween party plans.

If you don't mind a possible wait (and really, really, really dirty bathrooms, eek!), the food here is tasty....but maybe not worth the trip with so many other great places nearby at the Pier and Wharf.
author: Monica G.

description: Please go there on your own risk this place is a joke trust me they have Business because the location, it's better if you buy a little Cesar pizza for 5 dollars please don't go there even if you need to wait for other restaurants or go but a frozen pizza of Safeway
author: CJ C.

description: We loved the cute little view of the bay as tourists we were excited. lol The pizza was good & our waiter Vincent was amazing! He was so sweet & funny & his smile was amazing. Will be back for pizza! & the smile. Lol.
author: Ruby C.

description:
Inside looked promising but...

Waiter was awful. Snobby and clearly didn't want to be there. Food was not worth the wait and it wasn't until 20 minutes after everyone, except my sisters' food, arrived that we had to ask where her pizza was and the waiter said "Sorry I guess the cooks forgot about that, I'll go tell them". All the food was below average but as good as it sounds please don't get calamari. My sister's pizza was super greasy and the crust was just weird. 

Terrible way to end our long touristic day.
author: Alex O.

description: Wow. Walked in here today and the place is nearly empty while al other restaurants are packed. Was told by the manager that he was on break and couldn't help us until he was off break in 20 minutes or so. Needless to say he lost our business of 8 people not to mention everyone behind us that heard the conversation. If I could do zero stars I would have. Terrible!!
author: Cooper S.

description:
Here's things to really like about Luigi's:

--The clam chowder, honest to God, was probably the best I have had in years, and possibly ever (I like me some chowder, so believe me, this is high praise!)  I really didn't expect this--I just got slammed by intense flavor.

--At Pier 39 and the surrounding area, many restaurants make you wait before seating.  At the Rainforest Cafe this evening, we were going to have to wait 45 minutes.  At Luigi's, we were able to sit down right away without any wait at all.

--Sodas are big and bottomless.

These things weren't so hot:

--The pizza.  It was okay.  That's it.  Nothing to write home about.  I'm still trying to figure out why a PIZZA PLACE has just kick-ass clam chowder and such ho-hum pizza. . .

--The pasta.  Again, this was okay.  Not bad--it wasn't the worst noodles and sauce I've tasted, just not distinctive.  If you like whole cloves of garlic in your pasta sauce, this place is for you.

--The service.  Pretty friendly, but also pretty sparse.  The restaurant was only half full, but staff visits to our table did not not come by too often.

--The price.  As with all Pier 39 establishments, this is pretty high.  A 14-inch pie with only basil costs about $18.  But we expected this.  No fair expecting a bargain at Pier 39. . .

Overall, 3 stars.  The fancy fish houses may serve a comparable chowder, but will make you wait for it.  However, you're not going here for clam chowder, you're going here for pizza, dang it!  

Average pizza joint.  Just average.
author: Matthew D.

description:
STEER CLEAR!
After putting our name down to be seated, they started seating other parties before us who had showed up after us. As I was about to say something the lady called my name, and my girlfriend and I were seated with a family of 6 at an 8 person table. This made zero sense because there were two other smaller tables available to sit and eat at next to the table of 8. Food was very mediocre. Bland and Soggy Caesar Salad as well as what looked to be a microwaveable pepperoni pizza that you get from a middle school lunch line. Last but not least, both the men and women's bathrooms were indescribably horrendous. The men's toilet was over flowing with matter and was not flushable, as well as graffiti on the mirrors and trash scattered throughout the floor and whole restaurant. The women's restroom was just as bad, except if you put down enough seat covers it was slightly possible to use it. After paying for our meal, we were handed the wrong change back. It was only a little under a dollar, but it's wrong, no matter how much money it is. Will never eat here again.
author: Parker T.

description: My husband and I visited San Francisco for the Fleet Week venue.  We went to Luigi's Pizzeria and were greeted by Damik, the Manager.  He asked what has brought us to the city and then promptly seated us by the windows facing the bay, so that we could see the planes as we ate our lunch. Not sure what pizza to order,  we asked Damik and he suggested the meat pizza. The pizza came fully loaded, hot, and fresh.  One of the best pizza's we've had for a long time.  Not to much sauce, plenty of meat and cheese and the crust was perfect.  Damik took our drink orders, brought out the pizza and checked in on us to make sure everything was to our liking.  We found Damik to go out of his way to ensure we were looked after and everything was to our liking.  We would visit here again, as the service was great, food came promptly and Damik the manager, went out of his way to make sure our experience was fantastic.
author: Sandra J.

description: Well I just got home and threw up everywhere! This place is SOOO gross. I asked for a refund on my pizza because I could barely eat a piece because it was so nasty. The manager was great and had great customer service. But the waiters sucked a long with the food. I feel sick to my stomach.
author: Jessica M.

description: $8.99 for 6 mini pieces of garlic bread that were not very tasty.  We are a party of four and that appetizer did not go far.
author: DeeDee L.

description: The absolute BEST gluten free pizza we have ever had!! We got the white sauce and just pepperoni and it was fantastic! The way the crust was cooked was truly amazing. Highly recommend!!!!! AND our waiter, Vladislav, was AWESOME: so nice and friendly. He also gave us updates on how our pizza was coming along. The green and sweetened teas were also very good. Wish we lived here so we could go there every week!!
author: Steph M.

description: My wife and I stopped in for lunch on a very busy Monday afternoon. On a holiday as well.  We were seated within a few minutes. Our orders were taken a short time after.  Our food was brought out in about 15 minutes.  For pizza that is an average time. Food was spectacular.  We likened it to Via Napoli restaurant in Epcot, Walt Disney World.  The waiter was very attentive.  Even appoligized for not getting to us sooner.  By the way, he was at our table every 5 minutes checking on us.  Outstanding service. The owner /chef came and checked on us as well.  A must see place to eat. We are bringing our kids with us on the next trip. See you there!
author: Rob L.

description:
My family (of four)  and I went there and on a Saturday night after a long day of exploring the City. We were seated right away but that was the only thing that was quick or decent about our visit. 

We ordered an Alfredo pizza, salad and clam chowder and a make shift fettuccini Alfredo (since it was the one thing that my son wanted and it was something they didn't have.) We sat by the kitchen and the lights were off in the hallway into the kitchen the whole time... Which probably helped to hide the piles of trash that were littered on the floor. 

My daughter had to use the restroom and I was seriously disturbed that they have an commercial sized trash can that was overflowing with trash and no toilet paper. That is where I lost my appetite. 

I think I could have opened a can of clam chowder, put a boxed freezer pizza in the oven and probably had a better meal. 

After taking our order, our server literally never showed his face. The waiter station was behind us and after I had to ask the manager for the check  he reached around to dropped off our check, pick up our card, and drop the bill to be signed. My son called him "the hand" cause we only saw his arm and hand. 

The kicker .... The bill was $90!! 

The only positive to this place was the location because it was on the pier and it traps tourist. 

This was the only bad meal we had on our trip. Totally regret going here.
author: Stephanie R.

description: This place is a joke. Pretty sure the only reason they get business is because they are on the pier. Pizza is gross, the bathrooms are DISGUSTING, they don't have a kids menu and don't serve half orders of anything and the food takes forever. DONT COME HERE!!
author: Jamie M.

description: Not worth the time or money. We weren't greeted at the door to be seated, so we just walked in to pick a seat. I asked a server if she could wipe our table and she told me it was already cleaned and she continued to walk off in another direction with our menus she grabbed for us.. Another server wiped our table instead and grabbed us some menus. A man came and took our order. Our food came within 15-20 minutes. the food was alright.  We weren't checked on not once, not even to see if we wanted refills or even to see how the food tasted!! After we were done, i had to go ask for my receipt. Bad service, very bad service. i was not pleased at all. No service=No tip, seriously glad we paid cash. Lucky for them we were polite enough to stack our dishes...
author: Antonio G.

description: Giving it one star because when my friend and I walked in no one helped us, they gave looked at us and pretended like they didnt see us as to avoid actually doing thier job. We sat ourselves, grabbed our own menus and actually had to ask for someone to help us. After we were finally helped, everyone that came in after us was helped as soon as they walked in which is ridiculous. The customer service is terrible and we will not be going back again.
author: Odd O.

description:
Sub par food. 
Waiter only visited table once to take order.
Chicken parm....there was no chicken.
author: Chris W.

description: We came to Pier 39 so our son could go to the arcade. While there he expressed he wanted pizza so Luigi's it was as it is the only pizza spot at the tourist trap. We didn't expect much, as it is a trap but we were pleasantly surprised. The pizza and food is excellent and not overpriced. Slav, our server made the night for us- he was attentive, kind and accommodating. Thanks Slav!
author: Christine P.

description: Very long wait for very bad service. Food portions were too small for the price. Terrible seating. Even Olive Garden is a better alternative.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Good pizza. Good view. Good service. We ordered the penne pesto and the Luigis favorite pizza, and we're satisfied with both! It is a slow night, so we were seated right away and got fast service. The table is all carved up with people's initials and hearts, it is a pretty low key joint but overall a nice place to eat on the pier.
author: Amber H.

description:
Ahh...after sitting in traffic over 2 hours coming from Hayward we ended up at Pier 39 and saw they had a pizza place, considering we wanted to try a pizza place further out in SF and we were so hungry. 

Check in - a little bizzare. The hostess was just off.
Our waiter - sweet as pie, but he was a little spacey as well.
It seemed like most of their staff were just wandering around. Coming out of the kitchen with peoples food looking lost, like they didn't know which table it was going to. 

We ordered their clam chowder and it was delicious, however, we asked for pepper as the tables only had salt and red pepper flakes (WTH?) and waited so long that we asked a neighboring table for their pepper. The soup was getting cold. -SIGH- My husband ordered their spaghetti, I ordered their Treasure Island pizza and 2 Arnold Palmer's. The spaghetti was good, the pizza was cooked to perfection but the crust and toppings had no flavor, it was bland, like the ingredients were old. The Arnold Palmer's were weak.

What ALMOST made me go OFF is the fact that when the waiter ran my credit card, he brought back our parking validation, credit card and NO RECEIPT showing what he ran. I told him there was no receipt and he said "Oh, let me go look for it". Oookaaaye....this has never happened before. He comes back and says he couldn't find it and flips the original bill over and was about to draw a line with an X for me to sign it and I told him "Absolutely not! I need a receipt!" WHO DOES THAT?!!!! You aint about to just flip this paper over and tell me to sign it. It's called a REPRINT, and that's exactly what he did. I shooooole wasn't about to leave a tip, but saw that they impose a mandatory tip on the bill anyway. SMH.

I wouldn't return but gave it 2 stars anyway because of the chowder and spaghetti.
author: Denise H.

description:
This pizza was very close to Digiorno. Save yourself the money if you want that. Do not go here if you want a true pizza. 
The hostess was not at the hostess stand and a manager had to seat us.
The worse is food splattered on the walls and ceiling you can look at if you want a window seat. 
The place was 1/8 full at 7:00 on a Saturday night. Should have been a sign. We tried it anyway and were absolutely disappointed. 
Never again yuk
Would have given zero except for manager, who tried to do it all.
author: David O.

description:
Pretty darn good pizza, especially in a tourist area. The place is big. Price is more than your local joint but that's because of the area. $50 for two small pizzas and wings. 
The service was great. Chris was our waiter. He was great!
author: Nikki R.

description: All that I can say about this place it's the beautiful view. Definitely not satisfied with the overpriced food. Bubba gum had a long wait and we were starving, I should've waited :/
author: Natalia P.

description:
After a long drive to San Francisco, we were tired, hungry and most other places at Pier 39 quoted 30 minute to 2 hour waits. Despite the lower star rating for Luigi's, we decided to try it. And thankfully we were not disappointed. 

The pizza was outstanding.  I ordered a make your own pizza with extra cheese, light sauce, pineapple and Canadian bacon. It was perfect. My husband ordered the pepperoni and we got my toddler daughter a slice of cheese. My mother in law ordered a salad which she also enjoyed. In addition, we ordered some cheesy garlic bread which was also tasty, The view was incredible and we did not care that this was a very casual place. It was perfect for these hungry tourists. We had absolutely no issues with service and felt that the wait time was normal.

We will go back next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Susan M.

description:
This place was definitely so randomly put out of somewhere at the Pier 39 and nowhere as good as a Pizza Hut down the street. The food was just OKAY and If it were to be the last place opened out here, would I only go. 

I ordered a medium pizza and they offer to let you have two different pizzas combined into one so that you'll get half and half of what you like on their menu. I got the Combo and Alfredo chicken. We also ordered the hot wings for appetizer but didn't care too much for that. It was meh. So SKIP THE WINGS!!!!

Brian was my server and accommodating as he was, he attended to our needs most of the time. I like it that he came over and checked up on us often which was NICE, but probably was the only thing nice about this restaurant. 

Maybe I'm a picky eater, maybe I am not. But reviews do speak for itself, I'll let you be the judge of that.
author: Kathy P.

description: Food is good. The customer service is awesome. Our waiter knew we were from out of town and took the time to recommend places to see.
author: Tim F.

description: I was a little grumpy when i stepped inside Luigi's. I was none too happy to be visiting a pizza place while on Pier 39, and a touristy pizza place at that. But that was what the group wanted. While it wasn't the greatest pizza in the world it wasn't awful. The crust was buttery with a parmesan and herb dusting but the pie was a bit undercooked. The Treasure Island (italian sausage, ground beef, mushroom, bell pepper & onion) was bland. The meat lovers was not. Anyways, Luigi's turned my frown upside down.
author: Josh N.

description:
Me and my significant other came here; got seated; waited for 10 minutes while servers walked past us... On my way out (after not being able to wait any longer, as my stomach was growling) I spoke to the manager about the lack of service received,  he said "thanks for telling me. " That was it. 

In conclusion, come here if you don't care about service, and like mediocre food as well!
author: Chondra K.

description: It was a pizza place. There was nothing special about it. The crust was not great. The dining room didn't look super clean, but if you are just expecting a no frills pizza joint then this place will be fine with you.
author: Christine O.

description: Nice little pit stop on the pier for pizza. Waited a little while for menus/drinks. But the pizza was yummy and the waitress was incredibly nice. I'd come back next time for more yummy pizza for sure.
author: Kassie D.

description:
So I'm not gonna lie, Luigi's was not our first choice.  In town for business, a buddy and I decided to hit the crowded Pier 39 for dinner. Bubba Gumps was our destination but, after seeing their sign, we made a detour. 

The place is sort of small, maybe 15-20 tables and there some folks that found themselves waiting. We were seated immediately and were promptly helped 

We're a couple if big boys so we ordered a large meat lovers and he had a couple beers while we waited. The waiter was helpful by suggesting other beers and giving a small taster. 

The pizza arrived in time and it was fantastic. Hot, crispy and hearty. The two of us polished the pizza and settled our reasonable $42 tab ($24 for 'za, $14 for brew).
author: Brian P.

description:
I came in around 9pm, and no one was at the podium, like in other reviews, however we were seated quickly and kindly by our waiter. The food and table service was good, food came hot and in a timely matter, and the portions for the price, imo, was excellent.

I had to bump it down to 3 stars, because when I went here Saturday, the woman's restroom has piss EVERYWHERE, as if a man was in there.
Then, there was a kick on my door, and the handle jiggled, like someone was trying to come in, which was odd because when you lock  the door, theres a sign that turns to a red occupied sign.

My date was in front holding our our leftovers, and told me that he saw a worker kick the door, and didn't think much of it until the worker started turning the knob.
The men's room was not occupied atm, the womens restroom is not a private bathroom for the workers, not to mention Is it illegal for men to use women's restroom facilities at place of employment, when ample "men's" restrooms are available.

Although the food and service was great, it left a reeking feeling of disrespect. 

I don't see myself coming back to this establishment.
author: Natalie C.

description: Service was fine and fast, food is good, but "Luigi's" must be Italian for "over-priced". If you're looking to drop $7 for French fries, and $13 for a personal pan pizza, this joint is for you!
author: Chris D.

description: Since all the restaurants had over an hour wait we ended up here. The staff was horrible.  They took forever to bring anything we asked for. We ordered the clam chowder which was cold. We also ordered the barbecue pizza and pesto pizza which was very good.
author: Erika i.

description:
If I could give this place 0, I would.
There was no host to seat us or even talk to us as soon as we walked in. We had to wait a good few minutes to even be acknowledged. One employee was even complaining about working as he was getting off.
The huge bathroom was filthy, with toilet paper everywhere and no paper towels, and the toilet wouldn't flush right. The cabinet with the supplies was open but all that was in there was toilet paper.
The food was just okay. The shrimp scampi that we ordered was $18.99, but portioned for a child, honestly. We should have just went with the pizza, but the build your own charges for more than 1 topping apparently.
Service was okay, he checked on us often and asked us how the food went.
In the end, our server wrote in a 18% tip with a total. We didn't expect him to charge us that 18% tip, but he did. I should have said something but with that topping off my experience, I paid that 18% to never come back to this place and write this review. Not worth the time, money, or parking validation. Sorry.
author: Sheena F.

description:
I ate here once with a girlfriend about 12-13 years ago, which we had a great, friendly service and the place was busy during lunch hour then. Present time, there wasn't a lot of patrons dining here, but the taste of food is still flavorful and service? Friendly as I remembered many years ago.

My son had the Kids Cheese pizza, which came out with 2 generous slices + Apple juice.

I had the same dish from 12-13 years ago called, Eggplant Parmesan although the one I had today looked totally different compared to then. The one I had today came with 2 slices of bread along with the Parmesan eggplant, but also with spaghetti. I wasn't sure if the waitress got my order mixed up or what, but either way, I decided not to complain. The food the waitress brought out looked delicious either way and the service was excellent.

Definitely a to go place, IF, you're craving for Italian food.

Also, Luigi's Pizzeria does validate, IF, you parked at the Pier 39 parking garage.

From where we were sitting, we had a great view of the Cruise ship/Aquarium of the Bay plus the Coit Tower along with the whole San Francisco view was just beautiful to stare.
author: Risa S.

description: If i can give negative stars i would. Well, I think they should lower their prices because their service was really bad. The servers are not accommodating. They don't even respond when we call them. They did not give us any plates when we ordered pizza. And we did not have any utensils. How are we supposed to eat. I will never come back here. Terrible dining experience.. The food is not bad but the service is terrible. It's like they don't have their manager. And it's so disorganized. I felt disrespected and ignored. Hope the manager or the owner read this so they could do something about it. They can hire more staff. And also if they can do something about the restrooms. They always have a long line waiting.
author: Leinad I.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend in New Years eve to grab a quick bite before the 12am fireworks on the pier and let me start off by saying that for the price you pay, the portion is not worth it.

My boyfriend and I are huge pizza eaters, we've tried many spots and this one is definitely not the business, even Little Caesar's pizza dumps on this place and Little Caesar sucks.

Not only was the biggest pizza size small, it was also very bland and not memorable at all.

Overall I won't be coming back to this place, good location but terrible food. Next time I'm in the city and by the piers I'm just going to wad straight to the fisherman's wharf.
author: Phoebe T.

description: Took forever to get pizza and when it got to our table it was cold.  Waitress said that was very hot.   Not sure she understands a hot pizza.   Got a veggie and a cheese pizza.  Overpriced.
author: Al P.

description:
Was meeting up with my fiancé's family, who was visiting from out of town. They wanted pizza on the pier and I knew I had been to a pizza place before but I thought it was Pizza My Heart. 
Anyway, we met at Luigi's, they had called in a reservation and our table was waiting for us. Hostess greeted each of us as we staggered in and the server greeted us quickly. Speed of service was better than normal for a party of 10 and the pizza was delicious. I loved the thin crust and they do not skimp on cheese. The chicken Alfredo was delicious, the sauce tasted really authentic and not out of a jar. 

There were a few negatives:
-Some of the draft beers on the menu were out, leaving minimal beer choices.  

-Unfortunately, the bathroom smelled like bathrooms by the sea tend to smell, like old plumbing. I know that's hard to help, but the messy bathroom can be tended to more.  

All in all, this place is better than the 2.5 star rating it currently has. Perfect for family night at Pier 39.
author: Lisa F.

description:
5 year old child with a picky palate. Pizza was on his mind and there was nothing in sight at Pier 39 and then we spotted Luigi's... we should have gone the other way :/

Adults ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl. We got the child a kid's sized pizza slice. The clam chowder was bland and tasted like a high sodium progresso soup. The bread bowl was way rubbery. And the kids pizza was something that the kid could have made him self. Dry with little to no sauce and the cheese was few and far in between. 

Service was slow and hard to come by...but its a tourist trap and I didnt expect Ritz like service. 

$40 bucks later...we are not amused :/
author: Michelle I.

description: I ate here for the very first time and I loved it! Yeah it was packed and loud but only because there was a birthday party there so I wasn't disappointed or complaining. I share a large cheese pizza with my sister and aunt, and by far the best cheesy pizza I've had! Also the service there was friendly and great!
author: Kaile B.

description:
If you are looking for an alternative to seafood on Fisherman's Wharf, you might want to save yourself some grief and go somewhere else.  I would have give zero stars if I could have. 

We chose this restaurant initially because it seemed to have enough variety on the menu to appeal to our party of 16 and could seat us in less than an hour.  We should have known it was a bad idea when the 10-15 minute wait turned into 30.  We also failed to check yelp reviews, but we will next time!

I don't even know where to start. The waiter took at least another 15 minutes to bring us water or ask for our orders.  The restaurant wasn't very busy, and they had a LOT of wait staff, but everything took an agonizingly long time. They have vegan cheese, but no vegan pizza.  I will repeat that:  VEGAN cheese, but NOT vegan pizza CRUST. 

Amusing (but annoying) moments:  
- They brought one person 'bo-less' buffalo wings and didn't understand why she didn't want that (not what she ordered?).  
- When asked what was on a pizza (so he could tell him whether or not it was his), the server said, 'I don't know. There are 'toppings' - it was his first day, so he could not identify the ingredients.  
- Wine was poured from a glass, not the bottle - odd.  

In general, the food was not 'horrible,' but it was a big disappointment ... And definitely not worth what we paid. The $27 large pizza was especially disappointing. 

When we complained to the waiter and the manager, we were given apologies, but zero attempt to make us less annoyed. 

I want to repeat my biggest complaint:  vegan cheese, but NOT vegan pizza. The crust has butter AND egg in it. I have made pizza dough many times, and I never used either ingredient.
author: Janis A.

description: Came in here yesterday with the fam. Service was a bit slow, there seemed to be only one server and maybe 2 helpers. Food was good.
author: Alex S.

description: Worst place ever the waitress sucks the pizza is like frozen pizza!!!!if u plan on coming here with your family u will be disappointed and pissed off.
author: Vince O.

description: Can't leave SF without coming here. Very friendly atmosphere. Wonderful view of the bay. Have come here and will still love it! If you're on the Pier and looking for good food at good prices, Luigi's is the place!
author: May F.

description:
*****THIS PLACE CHARGE MY CREDIT CARD $20.00 OVER THE BILL*** I paid the waiter in cash! What is heck?  

I had called and the manager and he was suppose to get back to me over a week ago. What is extremely frustrating is when you call in and press 3 or 4 its rings then you are disconnected.  This has happened 9 separate times.  I called tonight and once again after pressing 3 and it ringing over and over again I was disconnected. 2nd-3rd call it rang really wierd so I hu. 4th call I pressed 2 and I left a message. 

I'm fuming at this point!

The pizza was good, the view at night is amazing.  Staff was lacking, however I still gave him a nice tip!

If this is not cleared up within the next 24 hours I will have no choice to go further to rectify this problem.
author: Tare M.

description: Honestly this place deserves 4 stars but I gave it 3 because of the waiter..  First off he took about 10-15 minutes to hand us the bill and then took another 10-15 min to pick it up.  And to top it off when he walked over to pick it up his first words were "did I mess up?!"........ Like he already knew he did. Soooo it was my first time visiting San Fran and pier 39... So I wanted to try clam chowder. They have the bread bowls here but I decided to just go for the clam chowder on a bowl.  Not a bad idea.  It was actually better than I expected.
author: Jean M.

description: If I can give this 0 stars I would! Our total was 63 but the guy scribbled it out and wrote 45! We were surprised we left 50$ and left. He came after us swearing then we went back and he started saying "fucking idiots" and "you smell like shit" and "go back to India" even though I am American and he was from italy. Anyways, turns out he but the tip as 15 dollars and wanted us to pay him that, he didn't realize that we tip him on the service they give! Anyways, I left the place to open Yelp and I was not surprised it was 2 stars. Disgrace!
author: Ilyas A.

description: I enjoyed the fisherman's wharf pizza we got.  The view was amazing and the location was nice! Yes,  it was a little expensive, but it's a touristy area.  My low rating comes from the horrible service.  Our waitress ignored us a few times.  Never brought us anything... Then the first time she came over she said 'you ready?'.  She never greeted us,  she never brought us drinks. I felt like I had to do her job for her. Plus asking for stuff inconvenienced her.  I tried to not let that ruin the night... But she just obviously didn't care about proper service.  Luckily,  I realized that was just how she was and she wasn't just attacking me and my boyfriend.  Everyone received the same service from her.  Also,  bathrooms here are horrendous! For a tourist spot,  that was embarrassing.  I walked out as soon as i saw the tornado that flew through the bathroom.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
I only went here because I was visitng Fisherman's Wharf with my children during a recent trip to San Francisco. They were hungry and Luigi's was  conviently nearby. Although the place wasn't very busy, the hostess seemed overwhelmed and asked us to sit at the bar while a table was being cleaned, only to call us to our table 10 seconds later. It tool forever and a day to order and the pizza tasted like a microwave pizza and even though we ordered a large, the four of us only ate two small slices each. Many other customers seemed unhappy with the service. I found out later that the tip is included in the bill, therefore the staff doesn't have to be concerned with quality of service because it doesn't exist here. 
The only positive thing here was the view of the Bay, other than that Luigi's left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Robert B.

description: I went with my husband about 3 days ago because I really wanted some pizza. They were pretty busy, but I sat there for almost 10 minutes while my husband was using the restroom and NO ONE came up to me to offer me something to drink or even to greet me. As soon as my husband came back, I got up and walked away. So disappointed.
author: Giselle P.

description: The food was good and all, but their service was pretty bad. First they took a while and didn't place our order after 15min, then my boyfriend found a piece of a metal sponge that they use to wash pots in his food, and then they messed up our order too. I don't think I would come back, but for the food and only one nice person that kept helping us out I'll give them 2 stars.
author: Ely G.

description: Don't come here...don't waste your time or money. Service is terrible and the food is just as bad. The clam chowder was runny and had no taste, the pizza was okay portions are very small.
author: Wilson L.

description: Way over priced for what you get. Pizza was ok. We ordered a side salad (over priced at $5.99) it was the most disgusting "salad" that we have ever had. A soda was $3.25 each and we couldn't even get a refill on it because the service was horrible. The host just pointed in the general direction and told us to sit there and he'd bring us a menu shortly. He never brought the menu we had to get our own. The waiter was slow and inattentive. People that sat down after us got their order taken and there drinks delivered before the waiter had even come to our table. 1 medium 1 topping pizza, 1 personal pizza, 2 side salads and 4 drinks was almost $70! PLEASE DONT WASTE YOU MONEY HERE!
author: Julia G.

description: My mom, niece and I ate here because bubba Gump's was full. We ordered spaghetti ( decent) , pasta primavera ( pretty good)  and clam chowder ( not good). It was nice because we were seated right away and got our food in a timely manner. The waiter was unenthusiastic, but did the job. I prob my wouldn't come back, but it worked for the moment.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I asked for bbq chicken-they gave me buffalo chicken and the waiter insists that i told him buffalo. I know what I said. Also, I ordered a meatball and they put it on my friends plate not mine. Do not come here. Service is terrible and food is expensive for its taste.
author: Ron A.

description: Local who decided to walk on over to pier 39 for some food one day and Luigis was the most quiet and pizza sounded good so I went ahead and ordered the meat lovers pizza there. Honestly I LOVED it, and the server was a cool dude as well. Mostly younger employees but all polite that I encountered. What would keep me from coming back all the time really is the price, it was maybe a $40 bill including tip for a pizza and a beer. Definitely a unique recipe that makes it stand out above other typical pizza places.
author: Jesse Z.

description: Eaten here a few times .. Taste like frozen pizza... Place is tired and needs a good cleaning ( musty). Great views though . Need to revamp pizza and it would be a hit
author: Meg B.

description: We came here for my sons 10th birthday. RJay was fantastic server. He made the night special for us. Constantly had a smile on his face. The pizza is good too but RJay made the night.
author: Christi F.

description:
Huh. The first ever review that I've written with a 1 star rating.

We came on a Sunday around 130 or so.

Alright...here's the overview of why they earned a crappy rating.
1. OVERPRICED (yes, I'm aware I'm in a tourist trap. But if it's going to be expensive as hell I want it to at least be justifiable.)
2. SLOW. Good lord... from the time it took going in to the time it took going out...
3. FOOD WASN'T GREAT. OR GOOD. I believe I don't really need to explain this one. But I probably should.

Here's the more detailed explanation:

1. For two people, the bill was 55$. Not sure if that was before/after tax and SF CITY surcharge (what is that???). For 55$, you can be the proud owner of a medium pizza and two pasta dishes.

Spaghetti with Meatballs - 14$
Penne with Pesto & Chicken - 17$
Medium Pizza (6 slices) w/ Pepperoni and Mushrooms - 17$
2 Waters

2. When we arrived, there were plenty of tables available. However, for some reason it took them 10 minutes to seat us (and I'm going to ignore the fact that it took us 5 minutes to find the hostess). Maybe they're understaffed, or maybe they're just slow. But it took them longer than the average pizzaria to deliver our goods. When it came time to get the check, we were sitting there trying to get ahold of someone so we could get the check. I actually had to go up and wait at the empty hostess stand for a good 5 minutes before I saw the check being delivered... I think our waitress saw me up there and figured out what I wanted, so she printed out the check. But the fact that I had to do that was exasperating enough without all of the other things. Oh, and good luck trying to catch your server. Note: I am very patient at restaurants; I try to be nice to everyone there and I don't like to have to be pushy. So this should tell you enough.

3. Um, ew as far as the Pizza goes. The pepperoni had an unusually chemically smell to them (more so than regular pepperoni), and the crust didn't seem like it was done. It tasted half baked and doughy. Usually the crust is my favorite part, but I couldn't bring myself to enjoy this. However, since I paid 17, I tried to eat it. My sister however, couldn't eat hers. She took a bite, made a face, and didn't take another bite. She didn't even want to bring it home.
The pasta is alright, tastes fine. If you must go for pasta here, get the pesto. Don't do the spag with meatballs. But I don't think that it was worth it due to portion size. See photos.

Note: I don't believe the menu on the Pier 39 website is current. It was different from the one we had when we went.

To sum it up: Don't go here. I wouldn't. Don't don't don't.
Or as Yelp says, Eek! Methinks not.
author: Nik B.

description:
We're in this restaurant at the upper level of the pier.... sitting above water.... and are served FROZEN calamari?????  Yup.... that said it all.  We ordered the calamari appetizer; the calamari had freezer burns on them!  Needless to say, it was not very good.....
Service was.... uh....  what service?  Staff seemed to huddle by the bar chatting, and food was served with nary a smile.  We felt like we were a burden on them... in an almost empty restaurant!
The good?  They validated our parking ticket.  That's about it.
author: Ed C.

description: This food is garbage they charged me for a free refill and they the employees are rude and food is overpriced plus all topping fall off if I could I would rate zero stars
author: Isaiah P.

description:
This review for just 1 slice of cheese pizza so don't blame me if you have bad dining experience or poor customer service.

I walked to the  counter and ordered a slice of cheese pizza for my daughter. She is very picky about Cheese Pizza but she love the pizza. It was just a short 10 minutes wait and I did not use the restroom to give any hygiene review. It would have been 4 stars if they put pizza in box but it was on the plate covered with aluminium foil and no napkins was given.

If you want a quick pizza and not wait 30 minutes for table, this looks like a good place but not sure how is the rest of the food,.
author: Sam M.

description: We waited to be seated, along with 20 other customers, for over 20 minutes. There were plenty of tables open, and it seemed well staffed. The staff didn't even acknowledge that we were all waiting. They didn't even look over at all of us waiting at the door. Even when one of us got the attention of the staff, they did not come to seat anyone for another 10 minutes. Very disappointed.
author: Ben S.

description: Food was bad,  service was bad.  It did not taste like real pizza,  not sure how describe it.....frozen pizza is way better.  Kids might like it.  Convenient location,  right on pier 39.
author: Harmony N.

description: TERRIBLE SERVICE!! Came to the restaurant with 3 hungry kids at about 6pm. We waited for about 20 minutes and no one showed up. We finally took the menus ourselves and had our order ready. Another 15 minute passes and no one has come to us yet. We finally go to one of the waiters and ask if we can have someone take our order. He shows up reluctantly and offered no apology. When I asked him why no one showed up, his response was that he was busy with other tables. FInally, we ordered the pizza which took another 20 minutes! We had to remind him to bring us our water, our cutlery, etc. etc. I am sure you get the message. I will never ever go back to this place....ever.
author: Apsara S.

description: Good tasting pizza, friendly service, kid friendly. Great bay view. Lots of seating. Even my 10.5 month old likes it.
author: Tony S.

description: Had to wait 20 minutes to get somebody to take the order, still messed up our order.  Employees just pretend you don't exist till you ask for them.
author: SuhRob K.

description:
We were at Pier 39 before Christmas because we wanted to eat there. My friend wanted to eat pizza, so we decided to come to Luigi's since it's the only pizza place at the Pier. 

We were seated right away, but sat at the table for like five minutes before our waiter even came over and acknowledged that we were there. We ordered a large sausage and salami pizza, half with mushrooms. I had my three kids with me, they're not a big fan of mushrooms which is why it was only on half. 

It took a good 20-25 minutes until we got the pizza...I guess that's a normal amount of time for pizza to bake? But there was only like three tables of people in the restaurant...I dunno. Anyways, I had good company, so it didn't really matter. 

Anyways, we got the pizza...it was okay. I don't think that they put mushrooms on it or they blended in REALLY well. Neither myself or my friend are big complainers so we just let it be and ate the "half" with the scarce/invisible mushrooms. 

My friend wanted some hot chocolate or some sort of espresso after dinner. The waiter was nice in telling us that their coffees aren't that good and to go to the biscotti place at the beginning of the Pier. Best advice ever! 

Would I come here again, probably not. Next time I'd hit up another restaurant on the Pier or I'd leave and go to a different pizza place away from there.
author: Rachel S.

description:
The buffet looked weak and sad on the night we decided to dine here. I opted for the spaghetti with homemade meatballs. The pasta was good, sauce was good, meatballs were good. I did enjoy it. My BF wanted the minestrone soup, but they were out (at 7pm on a Saturday night?), with the only option remaining being the tomato soup, which our waiter described as "crap" ... and he wasn't far off. We both agreed it tasted like they added water to their marinara sauce and called it soup.

Luigi's has decent Italian food (the only Italian option at Pier 39), but I probably would not go back when there are so many much better Italian restaurants a few blocks away in North Beach.
author: Sherry M.

description: Visited Luigis....was put off by the smell from the Carpets...décor could do with a spruce up...ordered 2 glasses of Red wine and a Pizza....Nice European Waitress, prompt service....but Pizza was a little bit too prefabricated....have eaten better..Wine and food acceptable but not world beaters..
author: Ray W.

description: I ordered a mini pizza and got a medium pizza. It tasted like a frozen pizza just warmed up. I haven't got the chocolate lava cake it was obviously microwaved after it cooled off it was so hard he could not cut it with a spoon. Also his chocolate lava cake arrived before the breadsticks he had ordered.
author: Hollie S.

description: Food was horrible and way over priced. 6 wings were $11. meatballs have a spice in them that does not belong in Italian meatballs (not sure what it was though). Table of 5 people and we left half of a large pizza behind since it tasted so bad.
author: Tony D.

description: The service was bit the best. Not any of the beer on menu was in stock. The food felt to be old and the sauces from cans...not fresh. Best thing about this place was the views. Maybe the prices if you order pizzas. Still sub par.
author: Jo V.

description: The food was great! Got our order taken quick and food came quick aswell. Friendly guest service aswell :)
author: Londra S.

description: Hey I came here and ordered a ceasar salad and asked for extra croutons and boy I sure got a lot.. i got a whole bowl full :o) anywho the food here is good it gets busy but not as bad as other places in the pier... the waiters were fun anyway... we ordered chicken parmasean with sphagetti and calamari and chicken pesto all delish :o)
author: Farrah F.

description:
It is a great view, but the Food is awful!
The Pizza was a frozen Pizza...
And it was to expansive for the quality...
author: Manuel M.

description: I made the mistake of not checking yelp first. Even with no real wait, a bad pizza took 25 minutes to get served.  I would prefer a $5 pizza from little caesars.  On top of bad service and poor pizza quality they over price the bad pizza. $35 !! Stay clear of this joint ..
author: Elton H.

description: It's a definite no. Way overpriced for what seemed like frozen food. Wait staff not attentive.
author: Melissa J.

description:
The customer service really sucked. My food was warm, no hot but I decided not to complain. The waiter did not come around at all to ask us about our meal or offer anything else. Plus, he took like 25 minutes to give us our check even though I had asked a different waiter.  
I had the Tortellini, which made me nauseous after consistently eating it. This place is honestly not worth the price and not worth the calories.
author: Miriam R.

description: Literally the worst experience ever! The food took nearly twice as long as we were told and when we received our food several of the appetizers were cold already. We asked for a substitution because it was just that bad. After waiting a while for the substitutions, the check comes. We pay and decide we will leave the tip on the table. On our waiters last visit to us, he asked how much we were going to tip and if there was anything wrong with his service because the tip was "small," when we gave him the recommended 13%. The service here was terrible!
author: Marcus T.

description: Considering this a pizzeria, I expected the pizza to be good. I should have checked Yelp before I came in. What a disappointment. They don't even seem to make their own pizza crust and the pizza was sub par. The waiter was nice so I'm giving two stars. However I definitely don't recommend this place.
author: Brooke R.

description: Fried Calamari appetizer was passable and came with two dipping sauces.  Pizza was just ok... nothing special.  Clam Chowder was the worst I'd ever eaten.  Only several doses of salt, pepper (and LEMON JUICE!) made it palatable.  I've never seen clam chowder that was more tan than white.  Service was VERY poor, even though we can in ahead of the lunch rush.  However, we got a table that overlooked the bay, so that was the big plus, but we were very disappointed at the meal for the price.  Will not go back.
author: P F.

description:
This is going to be really random. 

I mean, I'm having a hard time admitting I ate here. Yes. On Pier 39. Yes, I know. I LIVE IN THE CITY. 

But my family does not and after a freezing cold day riding a super fast on-off (we never got off) trolley tour of the east side of the city (where we passed my office 3x) and waiting in line for the bathroom (45 minutes of my life i will never get back) starvation hit. 

Someone mentioned sushi and I sighed with relief! I can live with avocado rolls! Totally! We got to the end of the Pier and the sushi joint was still boarded up: 

COMING SUMMER 2010. 

"It's summer 2010 already!" Cousin #1 noted. 

"Is it really summer? I can't feel my toes." Cousin #2 noted. 

"That's what you get for wearing flip flops in August." That was me. 

We backtracked to an Italian joint that my aunt said was pretty empty. HUNGRY was growing so fast it was becoming HANGRY. 

At least it wasn't one of the hundreds of crab shacks. What does a vegan eat at a crab shack? Probably dry toast and water. Sadness. 

Luigi's advertised a buffet so we took the starving masses into the empty restaurant and commandeered the 6 tables that were already put together in the middle. Our waiter sounded like a Luigi, so much so that I had to question if his accent was fake. He did everything within his power to sell us on the buffet . 

"Go check it out! It's awesome! It's got pizza! It's got pasta! It's got ranch dressing! And CROUTONS!"  He gestured wildly with his arms.

I got excited for croutons and then realized vegan croutons don't exist on Pier 39. *single tear* 

We checked it out and I said meh and perused the menu to find the magical pasta dish with no cheese. 

YAY!! 

When we ordered I double checked it's veganess and he noted they usually sprinkle some cheese on top but he'd ask the kitchen to refrain. I'm usually doubtful when someone promises this. One too many bad trust falls. Lo and behold when my pasta dish arrived it was SANS CHEESE!!! 

Thanks Mister Luigi man! I'm so sorry I doubted your accent and your ability to come through on a very important promise! 

Sure it was no frills capellini with tomatoes and basil but it was filling, comforting and chock full of garlic. I was appreciative. 

So vegans, if you find yourself in the unfortunate situation deep in the bowels of Pier 39, all is not lost.
author: Jen I.

description:
Ok....Went there after a hard day of hiking around the city.  We were in the mood for pizza.  We weren't sure about going in because the restaurant was empty when we looked in the door.  The funny thing is, that we joked that there isn't such a thing as bad pizza.  How do you mess up pizza?  Well we were about to find out.

This was the worst pizza that I have ever had in my life.  And that includes those Mr. P's frozen pizzas you buy for a dollar.

We started off with the cheesy garlic bread because we saw it mentioned on a yelp and they said it was good.  We got it at our table, and it looked great.  We bit into is, and the bread was soft, but not hot, fresh, steamy soft, but cardboardy, frozen, or stale soft.  It was very dense, thick and soft.  Not crispy on the outside, and light and soft on the inside like you would expect a garlic or french bread to be, but thick, heavy, soft, and crumbly.  It just wasn't right for bread.  It wasn't crispy at all.  It really tasted pre made, then microwaved or something.  It was like fake bread or something.  I just can't describe it.  Ok, maybe that was just a bad one we said.  Just the appetizer, right?

We ordered the combination pizza, and given how crappy the bread was, we couldn't wait for it to come.

The pizza was on the same type of bread!!!!  OMG!!!  

It looked great, the toppings were good too.  No complaints on the cheese, toppings, or freshness of the food.  Everything came hot/warm.

It was the crust and bread, that ruined everything.  The crust was the worst that I've ever had.  Maybe it was just plain flour and water?  I don't know!  But it was sooooo bland tasting, and the texture was the worst.  It must have been a frozen pizza crust.  You couldn't mess a boboli crust this bad!  Dominoes is head and shoulders better than this place, and a third of the price.  Even little caesars is better!  Safeway select frozen pizza is better.  Tombstone is better!

This was the worst pizza that I've ever had in my life.  Hands down.
author: Chauncey W.

description: They should really keep someone up front to seat people. I didn't think the food was that great, I don't think I will be going back. I asked for penne pasta with Alfredo sauce and they brought me pesto. They were nice about changing it, but just wish they would make sure they had it right before putting the order in
author: Ariana J.

description: Bad service! The pizza is just ok and expensive! Just don't go. Waste of time and money!
author: M D R 1.

description: If you go to this place, leave a tip or expect to be questioned why you're not leaving a tip even though it is completely optional. The view from this restaurant is pretty nice, the food was good but nothing special for the price and location. The waiter (didn't get his name) was nice, he checked on our table, brought us refills, etc. I was with my cousin and I told her I would take care of the tab & tips. I paid the total $40.40 with my card and I was planning on giving a tip with cash. I just signed the receipt without writing a total on it and gave it back to the waiter. My cousin had my purse on her side of the booth so I was scooting to the end of my seat to get my purse but as soon as the waiter saw the receipt I signed, he came back to our booth and he told me I didn't tip him as if I hadn't noticed. He wasn't rude about it but he looked annoyed. At this point, I wasn't planning on leaving a tip anymore. I have never been questioned or felt forced to leave a tip before. I looked at my cousin because I didn't know how to react, is this guy seriously asking for a tip. I look back at him and I take the receipt from his hand, I tell him I'm going to write the total. I write down $40.40 and give it back to him. Then he says, "you're not going to tip me?" I say no, then he asks "why aren't you going to tip me, do you not like the food or my customer service, I'm just wondering" the guy was loud so everyone near us could hear what was going on. I don't know if he was trying to pressure me into leaving a tip or if he was trying to embarrass me in front of other people but I wasn't intimidated by him.. I told him the food was good and I always tip but I didn't feel like tipping him after that attitude he gave me. I really don't like confrontation, I was still shocked that he was asking so many questions, I really just wanted to get out of there. I wonder if he questions everyone who doesn't leave a tip, I honestly would have left him a $10 tip because that's all I had in cash so he missed out.
author: Blanca A.

description: I was really hoping for some GOOD Italian food, wings WAY too salty, portions are REALLU small for their prices. Another thing too, is the BATHROOM! Looks like it hasn't been remodeled since it opened.
author: Hector J.

description: I can't even give this place a star because it doesn't deserve not a single one. We walked in there expecting to get greeted by the host. No one ever came to us we walked up to the bartender and asked if we seat ourselves, a worker approached us and asked us a table for how many and we replied with three and she just said pick any table you want and walked away. We waited for fifteen minutes with no one ever coming to our table. I looked around the employees were mingling with each other. I noticed other customers looking disgruntled. We got up and left after a while. Would have liked to try the food but it was just not meant to be. Go try Wipe OUT instead.
author: Anthony R.

description:
After a trip to alcatraz island we got pretty hungry. Well looking for  a place to eat wasn't to hard but was in the mood for some pizza. 

The atmosphere was pleasant and the view was nice looking out onto the water, the staff looked like pirates...well to me they did with their beards. The service was OK, would rate it higher if they ensured our drinks were filled as well as there seemed to be a limited supply of red peppers around different tables.

We started off with the cheesy bread, it was very cheesy and greasy, they provided a small thing of marinara sauce(we had to ask for a second servings of marinara). It was good.

I ordered the famous clam chowder, after all its claimed famous...I really enjoyed the added bacon bits and was probably the best thing I had here and would recommend it.

The pizza on the other hand fell short, with very little sauce and mainly cheese and bread. Used the marinara sauce to put some on the pizza. 

Overall I would recommend for the clam chowder, but not the pizza. Good for families who want something quick and somewhat affordable in a touristy spot.
author: Eric G.

description: Food was delicious and this restaurant has great views. We ordered tortellini and cheesy garlic bread. Food arrived in just few minutes and the staff that helped us were friendly. This will be my go to place at Pier 39.
author: A K.

description: Extremely poor service. Food was old. So cheap that you are not given sugar for ice tea. After many years of patronizing said eatery, no longer can make positive recommendation. Look elsewhere to eat.
author: Mike D.

description: My husband and I and our friends came here to eat due to Bubba Gump ' s being a Lil wait and we were hungry .... so we saw Luigis Pizza NEVER NEVER again will we return ..... the employees were EATING their food right next to us and talking shit about other workers etc ..... our server was awful looked like he did not want to be there ... our food was awful and service was bad , our server was serving a girl that ordered a slice of pizza to go and he dropped her foil and everyone saw it go down on the ground and she asked for a new one and he says it did not drop on ground "I swear" as we all saw it drop IDIOT !!! I did not tip our sever due to the lack of effort to serving us . The fact that the pitchers were $26.00 dollars !!!!!!!!!!!! Never again will we return .....
author: Karly W.

description: When the pizza finally came (not a busy time) I cut a slice picked up and the toppings cheese and all slides clean off the crust !!never had this happen! I thought it be better.average at best
author: E G.

description: Service was good! The buttermilk calamari was excellent. My father LOVED the pizza, he is a deep dish/lots of toppings kind of guy. This pizza was good but I favor thinner crust lighter pizza. The pizzas was loaded with toppings so if that's what you like go!! I would give Luigis a thumbs up. Very casual, not too expensive, three of us shared calamari and a medium pizza with three drinks for $45. The view of the bay was pretty great too!
author: Mica R.

description: First time in SF, and this place was great. I came in right at lunch time and was only the 2nd customer in the place so i got a great window seat. I ordered a make your own pizza that was amazing, fresh, and fast. My waiter Mert was super friendly and very attentive. I even had a ladybug that flew in from my open window join me at my table for a bit.
author: Edie N.

description:
We went to Luigi's Pizza as kind of a last resort - it was late, we were tired, hungry and a bit cranky.  We wanted a sit down restaurant where we could get a bite, a drink, and not wait for 30 minutes with my little girl.  Luigi's fit the bill on all accounts.  My wife and I ordered pizza while my mom had a salad.  The pepperoni that I ordered was some of the best pizza that I had eaten in quite some time.  I demolished my pie in record time, and I would have eaten more, had I ordered a larger pizza - it was just that good.  My wife raved about her pizza too.  Not a bite of pizza was left anywhere on the table when we were done.  And the cheesy garlic bread that we ordered as an appetizer (and to give some to our 16mo old daughter) was very good.
