The view was pretty good, which was also not something that we expected; we had a nice view overlooking part of the harbor where some local boats were docked.  

All in all, really a great experience for a very touristy place at the end of Pier 39.  I wouldn't hesitate to go back again!
author: David M.

description: HORRIBLE!! My dad and I came in here on Christmas day and just based on the location and menu- I wasn't expecting much but seriously this was way worse than I had ever dreamed. We were not greeted and sat down, took ten minutes to even be acknowledged and get a menu brought to us by a kitchen staff member. Then after about 20 minutes (!?) we are greeted by the only server who walks up to us. We said, "Hi how are you?" Almost in tears she said "Horrible- we are disgustingly overstaffed and actually I'm the only one here " We placed an order and almost walked out because it was taking so long, and we didn't get drinks and the place was visibly slammed. I felt really bad for our server- so much so that it made us uncomfortable. There were probably 50 people in the restaurant, all angry, asking for things and complaining so after no service for almost a half hour we tried to leave but she said the food would be ready soon so we took our coats back off. The food was surprisingly okay but we weren't able to ask for Parmesan or anything else that we may have wanted due to the service. As a concierge in SF- I would highly advise to avoid this restaurant. As for management, you should consider staffing more appropriately or perhaps being present as your restaurant is going up in flames. I'm sure our waitress cried after her shift- I certainly would have. My dad and I left pretty upset for how bad we felt for the waitress :(
author: Alex F.

description:
This place is the worst possible. I will describe my experience in the sequence of how it happened:

1. First, I stepped into the restaurant with my family and family friends. We were told to wait "3 minutes" exactly for a window seat. Only 1 minute later, another waitress comes up to us and asks us what we wanted and curtly told us to move aside to wait at a different part of the restaurant. It's not hard to do, but her tone was curt and not even polite. So we did so. 

2. After we gave up the window seat since 3 minutes obviously passed, we proceeded to ordering. We ordered 2 bowls of bread clam chowder along with other dishes, and the family friend also ordered 1 bowl of clam chowder along with one dish of garlic bread & other dishes. I am only specifying the dishes in which we had issues with, which is already about half of the meal. When the meal came, she gave us only 1 BOWL of clam chowder (bowl, not bread bowl) and 1 bread bowl. BOTH of which were not even lukewarm, but slightly COLD. Excuse me? I can go to Safeway and buy a cold canned bowl of clam chowder myself, thank you very much. We informed them of the coldness and you know what the waitress told me rudely? "I don't know but it was just made and I took it out right away." Do I look like I care? The problem is, the chowder is cold. Period. There is nothing else to say, and I am not an idiot that will believe it "just came out of the hot, boiling pot" and would turn cold in a matter of seconds. She finally told us she would reheat it up. Fine, if they fix it, I thought, I'd be happy.

3. She came back with the bowl first. It was lukewarm now. Great job. Then she came back with the bread bowl; it's finally hot-- I will give them that much credit. But when we asked about the 3rd bread bowl and why the bowl clam chowder was not bread bowl, she told us "That is what you ordered." Obviously I know what i ordered; she did not bother apologizing during the entire scenario about all the mess-ups and cold food. 

4. The waiter told us the garlic bread is "four slices." It was actually 2 slices cut in halves. Very sketch... and dishonest. 

5. Finally at the end, we were contemplating on giving them less tip for all the unhappiness brought upon us on this trip to San Francisco. But guess what the genius waitress told us? "Parties of 5 or more have to pay 15% gratuity." REALLY NOW? parties of FIVE? isnt it usually parties of 6 or more? so now we're forced to pay a freaking 15% gratuity for the WORLD'S WORST SERVICE AND FOOD AS WELL. 

To be honest, I am not that hard to please. If they just had good attitude and apologized for messing up our order along with giving us cold food, I wouldn't be writing this terrible review. All we need is some common courtesy for paying so much in a restaurant that gives so little in return. But they couldn't even manage that. 

POOR SERVICE/ATTITUDE, POOR QUALITY FOOD, AND OVERALL TERRIBLENESS. I wish I could give them negative stars, but the least amount is 1 star.
author: Linda W.

description: So we chose this place really because we had a coupon...Big Mistake.  We were so disappointed.  Our waiter was very crabby and not at all helpful when we would ask a question.  Our food took a long time to arrive & was bland when it finally did arrive (we ordered the Buffalo Chicken Pizza).  There is only a one stall restroom for the entire establishment (which of course we were seated somewhat close to).  While trying to eat our bland pizza, the hostess decided it would be appropriate for another party to stand over us while waiting for their table to be ready (about 5-10 minutes).   We will not be returning to Luigi's Pizzeria.
author: Jessi S.

description: Came here while I was waiting for a tour on Blue&Gold Fleet which I don't recommend. Anyways the wait wasn't bad but the service was considering I paid $40 for an appetizer, pizza, and sodas I was expecting more. The waitress was in a pissy mood and was extremely rude. We needed boxes and she delegated the task to someone else. Food was okay nothing great you can get the same quality pizza from dominos or somewhere else. Go to a different restaurant. I'm pretty sure the only reason they are in business is because tourists do not know what's good/bad and they are overpriced so that's what keeps them afloat.
author: Yosef S.

description:
I've eaten here about 3 times, I've had food off the menu and the buffet and I must say that I've never been impressed.

The buffet isn't really good.  The pasta sauce is very watery and the flavor isn't good.  The pizza wasn't good.  On a plus, the clam chowder was decent.  I don't remember it being watery, but I can't fill up on chowder.

The menu food isn't much better.  I remember ordering fettuccine alfredo,  and like the buffet, it was very watery and didn't have any flavor.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who was visiting the Pier.  Much better options out there.
author: Marcus J.

description:
Upon entrance, there were many uncleaned and empty tables.  The host was unable to seat my family and I within the promised 10 minutes because of the aforementioned problem, so instead, we had to wait half an hour.  The food itself was mediocre, but the service was lacking.  My mother had to be the one to call over the waiter to take our order, and that waiter also never checked up on our table to see how we were doing.  

Also! There were absolutely NO oyster crackers available to be eaten with the clam chowder.  What kind of restaurant on Pier 39 doesn't serve oyster crackers?!  The bread bowl itself had a bad bread to soup ratio...way too much sourdough bread.

Far too over-priced, mediocre food, not-so-awesome service, long wait. I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Christabel A.

description: Very friendly waiter not staff just our waiter everyone else ignored us including the 2 young boy waiters that look in your twenties. (Yes boys not men)that we're at the bar. clean Environment, Overpriced food. Ravioli taste Frozen and bland.
author: Shakei D.

description: Good FUD.  25 min to bake a pizza.  Agree with comments about under staffed.  Kinda dirty.  Needs vacuum.  No paper towels in bathroom.  But dirty napkins on floor by empty tables.  More to the understaffing
author: Tom B.

description: This has got to be some of the best pizza I have ever had. My wife and I eat here ever time we come to San Francisco
author: Nick A.

description: I love this place for a quick bite to eat at the Pier.  Family friendly with lots of meals to choose from on the menu.  I have ordered everything from pizza, to pasta and it is all delicious!  I will always return!
author: Lerae Q.

description: My husband had pizza and said he's had a better Hot Pocket. I had spaghetti and meatballs and the meatballs were dry. The pizza was made wrong the first time and the prices are the highest I have ever paid for pizza and pasta. Won't be returning.
author: Megan D.

description: Loved this place! The Bruschetta was super fresh and delicious and the Pesto pizza was awesome as well. Add the great wives off the pier and you have a total experience!
author: Jovana B.

description: Definitely had better pizza....it was full of oil and on the expensive side. Was here on vacation  and was looking for a good pizza place... Would recommend looking elsewhere
author: Deanna G.

description: The staff is very busy all the time, so dont expect great service. But overall its a good place to eat at the pier if you are on a budget and with a family.
author: Micah J.

description:
YUCK.  My boyfriend and I came here on a Sunday and every other restaurant was packed.  I figured that since this place was on the pier it should be at least alright.  

I don't even know where to start...

The hostess was nice, that one star goes to her (and because you can't rate a place zero stars).  

Food:  I have never eaten such tasteless food in my life.  I had the chicken pesto pizza, which sounded delicious.  I don't understand what happened...that only thing that had a little bit of taste was the chicken.  My boyfriend had spaghetti and meatballs.  I took a bite out of a meatball and it was the first time I have eaten beef that didn't taste like anything AT ALL.  At one point I had to wonder whether I had come into contact with toxic fumes that had wiped out my sense of smell and taste. 

Didn't order the salad, but I saw their "salad bar"...Pizza Hut has better salad bars. 

Service: AWFUL.  We waited 30 minutes before our waitress took our order (we might as well have waited to eat at an actual restaurant).  She never came back around, we had to hunt her down to get our check and waited at least a half an hour for her to come pick it up, but she never showed.  We weren't the only one with this problem, there was another group that waited with their check just as long and was holding it up in the air for anyone to come get it.  Eventually my boyfriend had to take it up to them after many failed attempts at getting some other rando waiter to get it.

Don't eat here unless your life already sucks that hard or you like bland, tasteless food.  After eating here I had to get french fries from a fast food place just so I could taste something.
author: Celine C.

description:
TERRIBLE! 

I came here to use a Living Social deal that I had purchased last year. I wished I had read all the reviews before doing so! 

We were seated quickly but took a while for our order to be taken. The food came out quickly and the Combo pizza was good; plenty of toppings. The bill came out too quickly considering we didn't finish eating yet but that does not bother me too much. When I tried to use my voucher, the server (Carl) who I presume to be the owner, informed me that they are not taking any Living Social deals anymore. Keep in mind that this deal does not expire until 2 weeks later! Their excuse? Living Social have not been paying them. They should have still honored it if they wanted repeat business, right? IMO, it was definately a stupid business move on their part.
author: Christina Z.

description: Very let down from this place. Can't even do a pizza??!!! Raw veggies and sauce wasn't great. Also ordered the pesto pasta with chicken. But came with no chicken!
author: Steven G.

description: Oh my. What can I say? It was a very busy weekend and this is the only place that has had a decent wait to get get seated.(5 mins.) but it took the server 20 mins. To get an order and 45 mins. For the food to arrive. Also the men's restroom is filthy and I mean filthy. Overflowing trash bins, calcified sink and smears of fecal matter on the floor.
author: Ray C.

description: Was unsure to try because of the lower reviews, but so glad we did.  The pizza crust tasted homemade and although we just ordered pepperoni and extra cheese, we all loved it (7, 14, and 2 adults).  we went at 5 pm on a Friday night and just beat the dinner rush crowd.  Quick service considering it was full, and we felt the price is more along the lines of 1 star and we are very budget minded.  Family of 4 ate a medium pizza, 2 drinks, 2 waters, $25 after tax.  Large was a few dollars more  but we wanted to save room for ice cream.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Had lunch here after the observing the snaking line at Bubba Gumps.

We started our meal with bruschetta, a lovely combo of freshly chopped onions, basil and tomatoes on a tasty, crunchy bread.

Pizza was yummy - our half was a tasty concoction of fresh mozzarella, tomatoes and basil, which my dining companion and I paired with a nice red wine. The kidlets inhaled their half of all cheese pizza (score!).

Every last bite was eaten, as if a Hoover vacuum was seated at the table.

Jump to the bathrooms (what goes in must come out).. Completely. Disgusting. Long wait, dirty bathroom, no changing table. Uuuuggghhhh,
author: caryl r.

description: I should have known this place was not going to be good. All of the other places had long lines and this place had none; we went despite my reservations. I ordered a garden salad (nothing like what I expected portion size was small, dressing was watery price was exorbitant) Chicken Parm which was O.K (sauce had celery in it, was watery and too sweet) and my nephew ordered Meat Lover Pizza (more on that later.) The service was horrendous! They were not at all that busy but we couldn't find our server after the dump and run of our entrees. I wanted grated cheese for my chicken parm, butter for my bread (creacked pepper would have been nice too) and the pizza they brought us was the wrong one altogether! By the time I was able to flag another server down, I had finished my food (without grated cheese and butter) and was forced to share with my nephew since he did not like the vegetarian pizza he was brought when he ordered a meat lovers. When telling the server about the pizza they explained that we did not order the right pizza....really? Why would we order something that he wouldn't eat? We were still charged the outrageous price for the tiny pizza which we did not eat. Would NOT go back, would NOT recommend. With all of the amazing places to eat in the area please do not choose this place.
author: Angela B.

description: Pizza was delicious and staff was great.  Had the pesto chicken and ate every bite.  Will definitely be back.
author: Fred P.

description: Not a bad place to grab a bite to eat. Staff was friendly and didn't have to wait to long to sit. Oredered the mozzarella sticks and created or own 10"  Italian sausage and feta cheese pizza. Food came pretty fast for how busy they were. Sticks were pretty good and the pizza was cooked just right. Not a bad meal but a little pricey for what we got, it is on pier 39 though......
author: Rod P.

description:
I WOULD NEVER GO BACK HERE AGIN!! Such a bad experience- I WOULDN'T SEND MY WORST ENEMY TO EAT THERE!!! Do yourself a favor- if you want to spend more than $100 on pizza GO SOMEWHERE THAT WANTS YOUR BUSINESS!!!!Gave this place one star because of the horrible service. Would have given no stars if that was an option. My family and I ate here last sat evening nov 14,2015. When we arrived it was not to busy but we still had to wait a bit for a table. Then when we finally sat down. The waitress who had to serve us did not want to work, I guess. She was unhappy to have to wait on our table. And blatantly looked over rolling her eyes and shaking her head, repeatedly. I have never in my life seen anything like that. Of course I wanted to leave right away after that. But my husband suggested we stay so we could all eat. We were there with our children, who are 12 & 18 so it wasn't small children. When she finally came to the table she said do u know what u want and we ordered. We then had to wait another 20 minutes just for our drinks. Then a kitchen staff brought our appetizers. When our food was brought out- pizzas - they didn't take our appetizer plates away. Then when my son needed a refill nobody would come over to our table. So I finally got up and refilled the soda myself behind their counter. Which wasn't a problem since no persons were in sight, except one worker who I asked to get the sofa for me and he said no go ahead. 
The food did taste good, however with this type of service IT WAS HORRIBLE. The only thing good we can say about our waitress is my husband liked her accent. But we watched as two more parties came in and each time she gave the same reaction. It would have been more enjoyable if we were in the other waitresses section, she appeared friendly and was definitely attentive.
author: Isabel L.

description:
Came to San Fran to visit my fiances family. We were all getting hungry & my fiances fam wanted to eat at Pier 39. Being from Miami, I knew these types of places were tourist places & usually not very good. My fiancé & I wanted to eat somewhere else, but we were already in the area & didn't know where else to go. We decided to get a quick bite here. BIG mistake!
My fiancé and I got the fried ravioli & cheese bread apps. The ravioli was basically just mozerella sticks in square shapes. The cheese bread was disgusting. It was obviously from the frozen food section. The cheese was not melty and the bread tasted old & stale. My fiances sister got some pasta dish & she was so grossed out by it that she only took a couple bites & that's it. She said it was frozen pasta. We didn't try any pizza so I can't say what that was like, but judging from the quality of the food we had, I'm guessing it's not very good. I'm really irritated that THIS was the first meal I had during my first visit to San Fransisco. At least we found some kick a$$ beer bars to make up for the bad experience at this place.
author: Katie W.

description: We ate dinner here and it was very much 3 stars.  All of the food was A-ok but nothing special.  The service was good.
author: Cheryl S.

description:
Ick, worst salad bar I have ever had. The scant selection includes iceberg lettuce, a few toppings that clearly double for pizza toppings like diced onions, some undefinable overly mayonnaised goop and terrible dressing that tasted like it came out of a huge cheap economy can. NO vinagrette, no olives, nothing that you would expect to find in any salad bar. The kid's sodas came literally half filled (or half empty depending on how you look at it) with no offer to refill them. My niece who normally has a really hearty appetite ordered the eggplant parmesean and ate a fraction of it. I left feeling robbed by the unbelievably high prices (which would have been fine if the food was edible) and poor quality.

At least they validate your parking for one hour, be sure to bring your parking stub.
author: Sarah E.

description: From the beginning of the meal we were skeptical for our waiter. He took a while to first greet us and ask for our order so by the time he came around for drinks we had our app and main meal ready to order. Our waiter, Vince, preceded not to write down our order. That would be acceptable any other time however he forgot to place our cheesy garlic bread that we were looking forward to and we never received. The water that we ordered took 15 minutes to get to us. Why? I'm not sure. It was only water and shoulda been at our table in 5 minutes or less. During our meal we were never checked on once. We had to ask another waiter to get is refills on our water. This was a highly disappointing experience. Especially since everything on the menu is so expensive. I expected way better service from the waiter. In the end we payed our check and he didn't even give us the correct amount back on change. I guess he felt he deserved the change as a tip wether or not we agreed with it. Needless to say I will not be back again.
author: David M.

description:
This is not a place to go.  What a bloody waste of money.  Many dirty tables, not cleaned yet. Slow service...food was ok..the iced tea was awful.. taste like they do not clean the glass....ugh..We ordered bruchetta which was actually really good which is why I gave the second star but the rest of the food, pesto pasta, and salad was not that great.  You are better off spending a couple of more dollars and eat a burger at Hard Rock Cafe or  Bubba Gump.  I seriously mean that. I feel bad for the staff here because they have to work for a dump.  The views are ok but not be thrilled about.
I am not even sure when the last time, the carpet been cleaned.  Not kidding here.....
author: Sweetpea M.

description: If I could give 0 stars I would. Waited way too long for our server to greet us. Then, the cheesy garlic bread looked like it came from a microwave and had a hair in it. The pizza was freakin disgusting. Again, looked and tasted like it came from the microwave. The workers were all as rude as can be! They obviously don't care about customer retention because they know they work at a tourist trap. Don't waste your money or time. Too damn expensive for food you can buy in the freezer section at the grocery store and heat up in the microwave at home.
author: Marissa F.

description: Pizza equivalent to frozen version from supermarket. Beers & wine over priced and tasted old. Messed up the order despite reasonably empty. Good location but don't make the mistake of going here for the food! Will not go here again.
author: Jonathan H.

description: My friends and I came here during our trip to San Fran. While visiting Pier 39, we were in the mood for some pizza. We decided on Luigi's Pizzeria. As an appetizer, we shared the calamari. It was just OK - I've had better. Being in SF, I had to try their clam chowder. It wasn't the best clam chowder but it wasn't too bad either. Their pizzas; however, were pretty good. We ordered the BBQ Chicken and Treasure Island pizzas to share amongst the 4 of us. They gave us a good heaping of toppings and the crust was nice and thick.  I wouldn't mind going back there to get the pizzas again if I'm ever back in SF. Oh, and the prices here are pretty good compared to the other restaurants at the pier.
author: Pugsly W.

description:
The calzone my hubby ordered looked gooey, cheesy and yummy! I don't think we'll come back to this place. It was our first time here and probably our last. My 2 year old ordered the slice of pizza which looked fresh and bricked-oven baked along with my hubby's pepperoni calzone. They enjoyed their food items, but it was definitly overpriced...what do you expect from a restaurant on Pier 39?! 

Instead, opt for getting lunch or dinner somewhere else in SF and just grab a light lunch or snack in the area of Pier 39.
author: Charissa G.

description: Took my family here on Sunday October 18,2015 for a good pizza. This place is horrible.... The food , was awful the pizza was like a $5.00 frozen pizza, the hostess was so freakin RUDE!!!! The waitress SUCKED too!!!! And all I ordered was a large pepperoni pizza and 5 cokes it was $55.00.... So ridiculously over priced I really don't know how they are still staying afloat on the pier. Warning don't waste your time or money!!!!!! If I can give half a star.. I definitely would.
author: Baby Bears Daycare C.

description:
This is one of the worst restuarants I have ever had the misfortune to have experienced in my life. My family and I went there because Bubba gumps was too crowded. 

After being seated, we did not get any greetings from anyone or any assurance that we will be helped out in any way. We waited for 30 minutes-nothing! 

At first we even thought we had to order the food ourselves instead of being approached by a waiter. However, the cashier only waved us back to our seats to wait some more. We ended up leaving after almost an hour after seeing other people being helped.

Overall, terrible costumer service and we didn't get to the food.
author: Cathy L.

description:
Maybe they would have gotten a better rating if:

1) It didn't take them 15 minutes to seat us even though there was clearly a bunch of seats and staff galore.

b) Once we got seated the waitress didn't promise to come back in a minute and was never to be seen again.

Troi) They gave a flying penis that we got up and left

And what I saw of their so called "buffet" was pathetic. Glad I didn't spend any money here, but I did waste a lot of time. But wait...time = money, so even though I didn't waste any...I really did. Darn you, Luigi's Pizzeria.
author: Jeanette P.

description: The food was delicious! However everything else a bad experience. Took 15 minute just to have a waiter come to our table, other tables were having trouble as well having to flag down anyone that worked there & even stopping waiters as soon as they came out of the kitchen, we even repeatedly asked for forks to a few different waiters and didn't receive anything. And after we got our food our waiter never came back over to check on us, we had to flag down another server for our check. Just poor service all around
author: Allie B.

description:
I've lived in San Francisco for 13 years, and this is WITHOUT A DOUBT the worst restaurant I have ever been to. The kitchen was dirty, (as was the whole place,) the waiters were nice enough but you could tell the food had just been microwaved. Despite how long it took them to bring it out it was white hot. The plates were dirty and sticky and I saw that the only way they cleaned them was a quick rinse. Once the food arrived it was flavorless and mushy. Disgusting.

The view was nice, waiter was okay but the atmosphere was a grungy dirty place with no class. I will NOT be coming back ever again. Sorry.
author: Iris M.

description: No strollers allowed. Pizza was greasy and flavorless. The waiter was pretty nice though
author: Crystal Shandelier R.

description: Very mediocre pizza, more of a touristy spot , not a place to go if your looking for real traditional pizza.  Servers are friendly but could be more attentive. Tourists definitely go, the average local it's not worth it!
author: Lina P.

description:
Went with family of 4 on Saturday Jan 15.  It took us almost 10 minutes for a waiter to even greet us so we decided to go with the buffet to make things easy and quick.

When we first took our plate to the buffet almost everything was out.  Maybe 6 slices of pizza  that looked very old and neglected(really).  The pasta bar was almost empty too, and the salad bar the same with all toppings about 99% empty.

Thinking that this was only temporary, wrong again.  We were there for almost an hour and food dribbled out from the kitchen and when a new pizza did come out it was quickly eaten up by the other patrons.  It felt like we had to stand up like scavengers to compete for a $13 buffet.

The little pizza we did get was undercooked and soggy.  Guess they were in such a rush, they choose to ignore the quality.  Ingredients seemed cheap and everything was super white bread, no whole grains.

I was not expecting much in the first place but this was THE WORST restaurant I have been to in years, no kidding.  

I did ask for the manager but they said he/she was off that day.  The girl left in charge said they only had one pizza cook and was sorry.  They should take the word "pizza" off the sign.
author: Sean M.

description: I like the fact that this place has a beautiful view, the pizza was just okay...the service was just okay. I've had better experience.
author: Audrey W.

description: The food was okay, not too amazing and so was the service. It took a while to get our drinks, food and check. The place was pretty okay for a monday and we ended up paying 54-56 dollars for a large pizza and the tortelini with alfredo sauce and chicken. It was good and tasted good, but i don't think i'd go back next time we're Frisco.
author: Nika E.

description:
The only reason my wife and I went here was because bubba gumps wait was 30 min and we wanted to eat and this place had no wait.

I had a cup of chowder and my wife had the tomato something, hers wasn't bad and mine was not that great too thick. 

we shared there all meat pizza and it was good if we were to go back it would be for the pizza.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
30 minutes to order. 1 hour to bring out the food. Another hour for them to tell me they didn't have what I wanted. And a final hour for them to give us the bill. 

1 pro: at least they gave us separate checks.
author: Bryan Y.

description: Try the BBQ pizza. Yum. Get a seat with a view of the bay of course.
author: Ajit G.

description:
We were kept waiting too long to be seated, too long for any acknowledgment from our server (who told us a waitress didn't bother showing up). 
They no longer have an all you can eat pizza buffet, just salad and soup buffet, which is all you can eat if you want to pay $6 bucks on top of what you're spending on your pizza or pasta. 
Pizza was nothing to write home about.
And as per previous reviews- the women's bathroom is still the same. Gross
author: Colette B.

description:
12.95 for all you can eat pizza, soup, salad, and pasta. I normally loooove all you can eat places, but I thought this was alright..wouldn't be my first pick to go back but it is something I'll settle for if nothing better or affordable for the amt of food is nearby.

Reasons for review:

+ 1 star and -1 star: The pizza was good, not great, but good! What sucked was that they served pizza to the customers once in awhile (like once every 10-15 mins)..so when a new try of pizza comes out..people are already swarming the spot like vouchers! Luckily, my husband grabbed a bunch of pizza for our table before it was gone. If it was me up there alone, I'd be trampled and tossed aside!

-1 star: The salad was okay, it had limited options on dressing and toppings. 

-1 star: NO LABELS! There were no labels for anything at the stations, so you didn't what kind of soup you were getting, what kind of sauces for the pasta you were getting, or what kind of dressing for your salad. You just didn't know..and you would have to guess!

+1 star: service was decent. Looked like college kids working trying to make a dolla. Can't be mad at that. He was good, came by to check if were were okay and refilled upon request promptly. 

Overall: Not sure if this would be first choice to come back..but if I were really hungry and just wanted alot of it, then I'll come back.
author: Milinh V.

description:
After a wild night of Hookahs and other unmentionable things at my buddie Ferb's place. My stomach was burning yearning for some Pizza. Stumbled our way to Pier 39 and found my way in Luigi's Pizzeria. 

While looking for a place where seafood wasn't the main course it was bubba humps or luigis, and since me and phineas weren't willin to wait 45 min for a seat, luigis and their pizza sounded appetizing We entered and were given a menu and were told to seat ourselves...unprofessional!!
We sat down and waited for someone to serve us.

With pockets filled with lint and past due bills, we opted for the all you can eat option. Excited with the thoughts of full stomachs we made our way to their buffet stands and noticed very cold pizza, pasta and yes salad with no croutons. To my dismay when I went to their pasta stand only two meatballs remained. Knowing the scarcity of the poor selection and quantity available of food I was sadly beaten to the last bread roll that was available by a random kid that was hovering around all the stands. Was really looking forward to bread rolls and the fact I got beaten by a kid who had a stomach that can eat a whole buffet saddened me!

After grabbing our limited amount of food we sat down next to a broken window, and hoping that the soup was going to warm us up, it didnt satisfy us because just like San Francisco weather, it was cold. Nothing but the beer Phineas ordered was good. After pondering for a moment at how ridiculous this place was, the thought of walking out dawned upon us. 

The waiters paid us no mind and didn't bother to even acknowledge us at the table we decided that it was time to just go back to hookahs and unmentionable things. If you like cold food and poor service just endure the wait elsewhere. We casually made our way out from the establishment..THEN ran down the stairs. Only after making sure to show them we were fancy by leaving a $2 tip. Figured that would better then a pocket full of lint.
author: Phineas F.

description: I went here twice. My first experience was decent. We ordered a lot of food because one meal didn't satisfy my group and myself. However, the service was amazing, and that's what brought me back. The second time I visited, I tried the clam chowder bread bowl... Don't come here for the clam chowder bread bowl! The flavor was amazing, but there was literally only 2 scoops of chowder and the bread was hard as rock and dry. It wasn't just mine; 4 others in my group ordered the bread bowl and experienced the same disappointment. Someone in my group also ordered pasta and she said it looked like they spread the pasta out on her plate to make it look like there was a decent portion. We all finished what was edible and left this place as hungry as we had entered this place. Also, the service the second time around was horrible. I wanted to ask if we could take out gratuity! Don't eat here unless you are rich and watching your figure. Otherwise I would just eat at Boudin or the clam chowder bowl place across Boudin.
author: Nia P.

description: Poor service. Very poor service. Waited for 30 mins for one mini pizza. When you check them what happens, they have the guts to say, sorry our computers went down. Order did not go to the kitchen, when we complained about the poor service they throw the hand and said, we can void the order if you want !!! When I complained the manager, he was like " we did what we could" ... NEVER go there.
author: Shantha V.

description: The garlic breadsticks were good. However, the chicken alfredo pizza was very tasteless and too cheesy
author: Ashley P.

description: Not sure about the other locations....but the Pier 39 location had poor quality food, dirty restrooms and a score of 80 (out of 100) on the city health report out front. The city inspector must have felt generous on his latest visit. Avoid this place!
author: Jim D.

description:
The pizza is NOT THAT GOOD, maybe because we choose buffet style. I gave 3 stars because GOOD FOR A REALLY LARGE GROUP.

I need a space for 65 people and they can accommodate that in such a short time. 

I called this morning and we got the space right away! The stuff was pretty friendly. 

If you park at the fisherman wharf parking garage, don't forget to validate!  


Buffet  $13/person included salad bar, clam chowder, pasta, meatball and spaghetti.
author: Fenny G.

description:
Not bad not bad...I'm not a pizza guy
My friend got the personal pizza and it was greasy looking but he's from NY so he said it was good. I'll take his word for it. The interior is quaint and has nice views oh and a gnarly statue of Luigi, scarier than WeeGee even. I got the buffet and ate some salad and soup and surprisingly the minestrone is good, the base and veggies, but not enough beans and pasta and the medium diet coke was more like a large to me, which is nice. Service was good, mainly I was just nibbling on salad (decent, not too bad) and eating the soups. Clam chowder is a bit watery, definitely not the mighty clam chowder the city is known for. After a long day of being tourists on a cold rainy San Fran day, some soup and salad for like 8 bucks off the pier is just what the doctored ordered.

Still, if you're at the Pier and have time, I'd say wait for the better fare. Our schedule had us going to faster cheaper places, so if you're like us on the rush and budget, Luigis is decent for the price.
author: Kenneth D.

description: Our original plans were to go to Bubba gumps, but the wait was way to long and being we had drove from san jose and starving we decided to try Luigi. BIG MISTAKE! For numerous reasons. The waiter was a drag he obviously had rather been else where then there doing his job. No smile not friendly at all. Then the silverware was dirty. The food was terrible, our tab came out to $75 what a waste. I wish I would of waited in line for Bubba gumps, would of been well worth the wait and money. Seriously save your money and time do not eat here. I think the only reason this place stays in business is due to the fact everyone's plans are to dine at Bubba gumps but once they see how long the wait is they get suckered into going to Luigi.
author: Victoria G.

description: Undercooked pizza. This was disappointing, the service was good and the pizza could have been good if it was cooked more. Only one bathroom toilet for women.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
How to begin...I entered the restaurant in the hopes that, while I was in a tourist trap, that the large space that the pizzeria had been able to secure and maintain was a testimony to the fact that while the food might be over priced it would be good. I have never been so wrong...
DO NOT ORDER AN APPETIZER! If you order the fried ravioli you will pay $9 for 7 ravioli that can be easily purchased at COSTCO.
The alfredo sauce is tasteless, like a neon green, sequined, backless, mini dress at a funeral tasteless. Even with the liberal application of pepper no improvement was made. It was as if this glue like substance was a black hole which absorbed the soul of other flavors and sent them to food purgatory. 
The pizza was "my boyfriend left me for his best friend at the prom" disappointing. Rough cutting onions in large chunks does not make the pizza rustic, it makes it inedible. Placing these under the cheese insures that said onions will not cook, thus the customer will bite into a large piece of raw onion.  Also little attention was paid to the canned mushrooms this led to the pizza having a metallic taste. The pesto was weak, coming from the same soul sucking family as the alfredo. I will not even discuss the bland, colorless, tasteless tomatoes that were thickly cut and placed on the pizza; I will not talk of how I walked by a wonderful farmer's market less than 2 miles down the road that had red ripe ones. Nope not even going to mention that.
author: Virginia B.

description:
I HAVE experienced better.  I just don't feel right giving them any higher.  We were in San Francisco to do a little get a way... see Alcatraz, experience the city.  

Loved the pier, lots to do.. and then we got really really hungry.  Bubba Gump-- did that before...so we decided to try Luigi's... 

We got there before the lunch rush.. BIG PLUS... but we went there VERY VERY VERY HUNGRY- BIG MISTAKE...  the service was friendly enough, but S L O W.  We sat there, stomachs grumbling, wondering if they forgot about us... Finally we order One Buffet, OneChicken Parm... cheesy garlic bread.. 

After a few minutes... we finally got plates for the buffet ( something you would have thought we got first).... and where my friend enjoyed the standard lettuce and veg spread ( a salad) and some random pizzas... i hated my chicken... spread so thin and cooked to a nice charcol color...  oh well.. the garlic bread was great!! 

As we ate our food we noticed the place starting to get completely full ( there were only 4 tables filled when we got there)... and people were getting agitated at the wait.... 

Maybe they were short staffed, but not sure what the reason would be for when I was first there, as there were 2-3 people serving the 4 tables....

There are not a lot of choices on the pier for sit down meals... so if you go here, get the buffett... and if I see reviews contrary maybe I'l go here again....
author: Samantha S.

description: The place is ran by a bunch of kids. The restrooms are filthy, the food is terrible, and the service feels like it's a favor they're giving to you. Only gave two stars, so that people read it, otherwise would've left one star
author: Constantine M.

description:
Stopped in on this spot with my girlfriend last weekend. I thought it was North Beach Pizza but I guess they sold this spot to new owners. I have to say it's a huge improvement from the last time I was here. Toppings tasted fresh, cheese was tasty and the crust is awesome. I didn't think their ranch sauce was thick enough for me. I like real creamy ranch with my pizza. Anyway solid pizza all the way around and the staff had us cracking up. It was a good time. 

O ya and they have Anchor Steam on tap! That's my favorite bear, yummy.
author: C M.

description:
I guess I shouldn't expect much from these Americanized Italian joints. They taste nothing like authentic Italian food and are mostly overly-served with tomato sauce and melted cheese. We had mozzarella cheese sticks for starters, the much-demanded-for cheese pizza for the kids and two of their specials from the menu: a small serving of their signature pizza and chicken pesto calzone

Read the full review here: http://inadvertentlydomesticated.com/le-critique-hole-in-the-wall-luigis-pizzeria/#ixzz1at7glga1
author: Ms C S.

description: THIS PLACE SUCKS! the food wasnt worth it.. for 2 large pizzas and a couple of drinks equaled to the total of $100 dollers! -_______- and the service was slow and the waiters talked like they were being fake.. Also the bathroom had no privacy what so ever
author: Anna G.

description:
Cheapest all you can eat pizza, pasta, salad and soup buffet on the piers! Carlos, the manager I think, was super nice! 

John P. is seriously stupid. I asked Carlos if he knew about the review on Yelp, and he explained it to me: The restaurant was inundated with a tour group, and that's why their service was terrible. There was an unexpected rush. As far as wet plates go, they were clean. Stop complaining. 

My boyfriend and I got the buffet. I gave it four stars because the pizza was delicious; we had the Hawaiian, pepperoni, and supreme.

The pasta they offered was spaghetti, and penne, sauces were alfredo(4/5 stars), marinara(3/5), and meat sauce(2/5-- I'm picky when it comes to meat sauce.)

Soups: Clam chowder and minestrone. I don't like clam chowder, but it smelled good, and the minestrone was pretty good.

They also had steamed and buttered garlic vegetables. Delicious!

Lovely view of the bay, and prices were alright, considering where you are(the piers).

Servers were friendly and I will definitely remember Luigi's when I'm back on the piers.
author: Megan S.

description:
I do not recommend coming here.

After discovering that the Bubba Gump nearby had a 45-minute wait, my party and I decided to go to Luigi's Pizzeria. The wait wasn't too bad (about 15 minutes) and the serving size, considering that we were in a touristy area, was adequate (if not overpriced).

The food is edible, but that isn't saying much. My sister, who had eaten with me, said that the spaghetti reminded her of school lunch food. Enough said.

In addition, our waiter was extremely unattentive. He only came to our table four times--once to seat us, once to get our order (but only after we had waited for a good twenty minutes), once to give us our food, and once to give us our check (but ONLY after I had gone up to our waiter and asked for it after an hour of waiting). Our drinks were not refilled once the entire time we were there.

Overall, try your luck with this restaurant. I think that, if we had known the quality of the service at the restaurant beforehand, my party and I would have gladly taken the 45-minute wait at Bubba Gump.
author: Travis N.

description:
This pizza is terrible.

A large 14" (isn't that medium?) comes lacking in toppings, sauce, size, presentation and just pretty much tastes like cardboard.

Plates brought out to eat on were still wet. Really wet.

Ordered bruschetta as an appetizer but it came after the pizza did. Each piece (6 total for 6.95) was like the size of a totinos pizza roll.

The icing on the cake is that they had an all you can eat buffet going on but the server NEVER mentioned it as a money saving option. 

There's no Luigi or Mario here. Just big bad Koopa trying to get one over on tourists. 

There's a reason I've never gone down to Pier 39 (tourist central) until now but I had other business down there. 

Don't go here under any circumstances. 

35.14 could be better spent elsewhere.
author: John Z.

description:
Horrible experience. Only ended up at this place because Bubba Gump had a 2 hour wait. Our party was of 11 people in where 6 were children. After our tour at Alcatraz everyone was pretty hungry. When we arrived they told us a 20 minute wait that sounded great so we stayed. Little did we know we had mad a bad choice.  When we were seated they split our group to get us seated faster. We were ok with that. One of the tables that we were giving was at a booth all the way back to the restaurant in the corner. As we sat down the table wobbled to a side looked like it was going to fall over. We decided not to sit there and risk the chance of our food landing on our laps later. Part of our group sat at a table across from the kids table. Our table was dirty and the guy who had sat us done said he would come back and clean it. That never happen he never came. I called someone over and informed them about the situation and he came right over and cleaned our table. Found out that we was our waiter and stated he would provide great service.
Well after that he never came back.  The kids remain at their booth and we saw a table by the window next to them that opened up and we moved over to that table. 20-30 minutes have passed and no one has asked us to our order. A different waiter came up and said he was helping our waiter out due to he was behind on his orders. He took our orders and 10 minutes later our drinks finally came out. 30 minutes later the kids food came out and the soup that some of us had ordered. The Clam chowder was Luke warm. Two of us ate it only because we were hungry and didn't want to wait any longer. One of us sent the soup back and let the waiter know  that the soup was cold and to please do something about it. You would think they would bring you a new soup, I guess they don't do that here because same soup was brought 10 minutes later and it was super hot due to the microwave time they had set it too.
The kids finished with their food and 4 of us were still waiting for our food. Who knew that something simple as two medium pizza's would take so long. The waiter came over and asked if we needed anything else.... Really?! Yes hello we are missing our food. I informed him of this and he said he was sorry and would look into it. 10 minutes later he showed up with our pizza's.... Our pizza's were cold. We all just looked at each other and let the waiter know but told him we would eat it due to we have been waiting over an hour now and everything just seem to come out wrong and we were frustrated by now. The main waiter came over and asked what was wrong so I told him. He offered for us to speak with the manager so I took him up on his offer. He came back later saying that the manager wasn't there but we could call him. I told him to disregard because I'm sure that was even going to take longer. 
Little did we know the kids hadn't received utensils when their food came out and had a to wait awhile for them to arrive after they notified the waiter. I asked for the bill and told them to take off he tip because they hadn't earned it with us and I was not' going to pay that. I was informed I couldn't do that. So my sister asked to speak with someone who was left in charge. Low and behold they finally came up with someone and we explained what had occurred. She said there wasn't anything she could do and she had called the manager "John" and said we had to pay.  I told her they should just take off all of the soups and the pizza off since that was what was wrong. She said she couldn't do that . I told her I wanted to speak with the manager and get him on the phone. She called him and the manger refused to speak with us. I told her I wanted his name an d number , that too she refused. I told her I wanted to speak with the owner and she made the statement of the owner being meaner than the manager and he was going to make me pay the whole bill. Really?! That wasn't the issue I was going to be heard by someone because this  was ridiculous.  I told her that was fine I still wanted to speak to him, she never provided me with his information. By this time I was beyond being upset ...2 full hours waited at this place crappy food and crappy service. Paid the bill and walked off. Will never go to this place again.!!!
author: Vanessa B.

description:
We only came here because the line for Bubba G's was an hour and a half long and we didnt wanna wait and this place was next door. 

The food was ok, you can get better and cheaper at an olive garden, etc. The all you can eat was a plus, the thats why I'll give it at least 3 stars, but the pizza was "eh" and overprices like everywhere else on pier 39...
author: Ashraf C.

description: This place is definitely better than the reviews give it credit for. My wife and I are here on a honeymoon and stopped here for lunch after Alcatraz. The pizza crust was pretty good. The pizza and garlic bread is average but fulfilled our pizza craving.
author: Matthew E.

description:
Over priced.... even for pier 39.
AVOID THIS PLACE!!!!

Very unprofessional !
We ordered an appetizer and 3 mini pizzas.  Two of the pizzas arrived, the appetizer nor my pizza showed up ... We had to remind the waiter  "We also have an appetizer and another pizza . Here was his response - "people in the back, forgot your order"

This pizza had NO FLAVOR!!! the sauce was very watered down,  I have had better pizza at a Pizza hut drive thru!! 

This place doesn't even deserve one star.
author: D K.

description: Food was delicious food time BUT bad service we were the first ones there got seated right a way but after it went down hill. We did n not get refills,server got my 2 yr old daughter a huge cup of soda and realized it was to big and gave her a kids  drink and got charged for the big drink. We sat there waiting for the check for 30 minutes and noone acknowledge us at all. Waiters just kept looking at us and knew we were getting annoyed but just kept talking to each other, 4 waiters there couple feet from us and didn't say anything. Our waiter did not even look at us or ask if everything was ok. Had to get up and interrupted the waiters conversation and tell them can we pay and they said where's your waiter. We just got up and started heading out the door until finally our waiter came up to me n said I was looking for you and that got me even mad. Worst experience ever and if you read this Luigis pizzeria I did not give a tip and drew a sad face on the ticket 6/29/15 at 11:20am
author: Carlos G.

description: Seating sucked. Wait sucked. Pizza had no taste...better places to get a bang for your buck at the pier. Don't waste your time or money here.
author: Davet M.

description: The only reason why I am leaving one star, is because I can't leave zero stars! I am so incredibly disappointed with this restaurant! My family and I traveled 3 hours to San francisco to do some sight seeing and shopping for the day. We were in the mood for some yummy pizza, so decided to give this place a try. The location is great, with a great view! And that's about it! We are seated and aren't even greeted by our server till 10 min later. I go to the bathroom to wash my hands to see a filthy slippery nasty bathroom. I come back out and our server finally shows up, we order our drinks and didn't get them till 15 min later, and don't even get our complete drink order! This entire time, the waiter wasn't even good enough to give us an explanation as into why it was taking so long. It is now 25 min that we have been there. Oh... BTW, we put in our food order with our drink order. We ordered one cup of clam chowder, one order of hot wings and a large combo pizza, kids spaghetti and a kids pepperoni pizza. We got our appetizers (wings and soup) 45 min after later! The wings were an absolute JOKE!!!!!! They were the smallest wings I have seen in my life!! And covered in Reds sauce, nothing special. The clam chowder was tasty, but wasn't your original clam chowder you go to Thee City to eat. It is now one hr and we are still waiting for our pizza! I finally see our waiter, and ask him how much longer it would be for our pizzas and spaghetti and he says he didn't know, but he'd go to check. He comes out 10 min later, with our large pizza and the kids spaghetti and tells us the other kids pepperoni pizza would be out in 5 min. Well it wasn't!!!! We waited 15 min and NO PEPPERONI PIZZA!!!! At that point, I just asked the hostess to get us the manager. As the manager comes out so does the pepperoni pizza. We tell her what's going on and how disappointed we were, and she didn't seem to care, she didn't take the time to talk to us about it, we didn't feel like we were valued costumers,instead she deducted the $24.99 that was the cost of the large pizza! ATTENTION to you LUIGIS PIZZERIA! We are NOT there to get free food! We are there to get GOOD food and GOOD service! She never came to check up on us after that. The pizza was bland and disgusting! I can get better pizza from a box at my local grocery store. The spaghetti gave my daughter a tummy ache and the wings were meat less! They asked us of we wanted a box to take our food home, ummm...No thanks!!!!!We were so angry that out of all the thousands of great restaurants in San Francisco we end up eating at the worst!!!! What a shame to them! I would suggest to Luigi's owners  that you take these reviews very serious, train your staff, train your managers, clean your bathrooms, fix whatever leak you have going on in there, and cook good quality good! I will never ever go here again!
author: Mg M.

description: Listen to the bad reviews do not make the same mistake i did and go in anyway. Pizza sucks little Caesars pizza is better than this. Never coming back again on my trips to San Fransisco.
author: Robert C.

description: Wanted to go to Bubba Gumps, but they were super busy! Thus, I went to Luigi's next store.  If I had to choose between eating their spaghetti again or getting punched in the face by a midget, I would choose mini-me!  If you are a midget reading this review, please do not be offended! Their clam chowder was straight out of a can! Ditto with the spaghetti! I rarely complain, but save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else! This restaurant should be called Chef Boyardee!
author: Michael M.

description: Excellent pizza! Great mozz sticks and wonderful clam chowder!  Prices are fair... Waitress was wonderful!!
author: Stephanie F.

description: We went down to Pier 39 not really knowing what to expect. Looked at all our dining options and then settled here. The all-meat pizza was amazing! We ordered it with extra sauce. I wish we'd ordered a bigger one for the extra left overs! The food is a bit pricey, but come on it's a tourist trap! =D. The lasagana my mom ordered was ok, said it wasn't worth the $14. The pizza hit the spot on the very cold afternoon. The service was ok, one of the waitresses brought our baby some water for her bottle. All the waitstaff stopped by to talk to our baby and say how adoreable she is. I didn't think the bathrooms were in terrible shape as some have previously mentioned. They were clean and worked, which is all I wanted. I would eat here again and would recommend it for the pizza.
author: Heather H.

description:
Bathroom walls covered with gang graffiti, 
Used toilet paper overflowing bathroom garbage can.

Pizza was boring, but edible. NY style crust. Bland sauce. 

Service was good.

Restaurant decor was like the place has been vacant since 1976, then recently reopened. Generally clean dining area, but somewhat Russian-looking.

No view from the restaurant despite have an end-of-Pier 39 address. 

There are plenty of much better pizza restaurants near Pier 39.
author: scott h.

description: Not somewhere I would go on a regular basis. Their pizza is pricey - and the buffet is iffy.
author: Kevin M.

description:
We took our 2 grandchildren on a tour of Alcatraz,afterwards we were hungry so we went to Pier 39 and the kids choose a pizza place.
My husband& grandson ordered pizza which was okay. My grandson ordered orange soda which turn out o be only soda water. The waiter said the soda machine was not working but didn't tell us that in the first place,
My husband & I ordered ice tea which was actually sugar water,ick!
I had a caesar salad which was more like lettuce soup, way too much dressing. Our granddaughter had clam chowder, that was okay.
Very over priced for the quality of food.  Would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Anitra M.

description: The pizza was mediocre at best, especially for the price. The view was lovely. The service was pretty poor. The location is fantastic. In the end, the location/view is it's saving grace.
author: Amanda H.

description: This was the WORST pizza I have ever ordered for take out in San Francisco. It was very expensive ($16 for a medium pizza) , cold and soggy. I paid for extra sauce and there was barely any on the pizza! Very disappointed.
author: M L.

description: not a bad alternative for the usual wharf restaurants that you usually see.its a hit or miss tho since when theyre busy the food goes out pretty quick,definitely not a place for you if you just want a quick bite.food is ok and since its a buffet you go eat till you drop.
author: marcel s.

description: While out visiting San Fran we decided to walk over to Pier 39 for Pizza. The place was okay. We ordered hot wings which were pretty good. We shared a small pizza which was also good. It wasn't good enough however to say we would go back there if ever in the area. Some of it may be that they only have 2 bathrooms...one for men & one for women. The men's restroom was out of order so if you needed to go you had to wait in line for the women's restroom behind every man, woman & child. I ended up just having to use wet wipes & hand sanitizer out of my purse. Their website promised a fresh salad bar which is the biggest reason I chose this place but they didn't have one once we got there. The staff (except for the guy that cleaned our table...he was great) didn't seem very excited to be there. The place was dark & seemed dirty. (It wasn't dirty that I could tell but maybe the dark & decor just made it feel that way). Also, once all of our plates & glasses were cleared away we had to wait at least 10 minutes for our check & only received it then because we asked for it! Was very disappointed because based on the website & location I expected more.
author: Tiffany G.

description:
meh pizza at a Pier 39 jacked up price

when we were there the service was absolutely dead - took a long time to be seated (server was also hosting) and then forever to get food... with an appetizer being completely forgotten.

kids may like it but those of us with evolved tastes will scoff at their offering
author: Jon M.

description: Worst pizza I've ever had. Undercooked, sloppy assembly, overpriced....felt like an Izzy's pizza (local pizza buffet here in Portland...NOT worth it!). They might as well have stuck a Pizza Hut on Pier 39. Wouldn't eat here again if everything else on the Pier was closed.
author: Alex G.

description: Not from these parts - from outside US and should have consulted yelp earlier. Average food, expensive and not what I'd call value for money. Waiter Robert was helpful but he didn't have much to work with!  Paid a lot less for much better in NY.
author: Paul M.

description: Surprisingly, they make good pasta. And they make a good Caprese pizza. Good clam chowder too.
author: Marie M.

description:
We had a pepperoni, salami, mushroom, sausage pizza here tonight. My bf's half had no cheese, so I asked for extra on mine. I did not feel like my half had extra, but it was adequate. The pizza was delicious thought. We both really enjoyed it. I'm not a big crust fan, but theirs was seasoned just right. 
For a Sat at 7pm, it was fairly empty (about 8 tables full) and the service was quite slow, but exceptionally friendly. Decent bay view as well. it was a bit expensive ($20 for a medium), but there was a good amount of toppings and it's on Pier 39, so all prices are going to be grossly inflated. 
We enjoyed it, and would good back.
author: T C.

description: I'm giving this one star because I'm not allowed to give zero. I can't even comment on the food because we didn't even get to that stage. We walk in, place doesn't seem too busy, but the staff is no where to be found. No hostess, so after waiting, we decide to seat ourselves. The table was still dirty and had the previous diner's old plates and food. 10 minutes later, a waitress comes up to us and tells us that we aren't supposed to seat ourselves and asks us to move to a smaller table. By this time, the entrance was packed with people looking for the hostess and waiting to be seated. We sit at our new table for another 10 minutes, no waitress, no menu, no drinks. So we walked out and had to squeeze by tons of people waiting to be seated. It was a wednesday and there were plenty of uncleared tables around. If I had to judge the food by looking at what others we eating, GROSS. Looked like the cafeteria food I ate in 3rd grade.
author: Nadia G.

description: Great location! Below average food, less than average service.  I guess I should have not gone to a Pizza place on the Wharf expecting anything close to good clam chowder in a fresh bread bowl.  They even served me my Anchor Steam in a Stella glass.  The frozen Mozzerella sticks were not what I expected either. And the worst thing was although the restuarant was pretty empty with more staff than customers the bathrooms were disgusting.  Outside of all that it was ok.
author: Gino V.

description: Ordered lasagna, it was served to me about 4 mi utes later, obviously cooked by chef Mike(crowave), Coffee was cold,. Mens bathroom wash a shithole. The deadbolt doesnt work, but still says occupied when in fact its empty, lock is now a $1 slider type lock. Considering the world is visiting pier 39..who would run a shithole like this?
author: Rob T.

description: I visited around Christmas 2011 and was surprised the restaurant was so crowded. It's actually a lot bigger than it looks. I expected it to be some dinky pizzeria but it was actually pretty nice and the food hit the spot. It's a little more expensive than you would expect for this kind of restaurant but everything on the pier is bound to be more expensive. The pizza was better than your average chain.
author: Sara K.

description: Okay I am bit frustrated at the other reviews but none the less, I ate here on 12/12/10 and it was awesome! Our waiter was named Luigi (but not the owner) and he was an amazing waiter! We loved him! The food was really good. Some of us ate off the buffet and some off the menu but everyone was very happy and full!
author: Amber C.

description: Fast and friendly service. I had the spinach artichoke raviolis, it was very good!  I also started with the clam chowder, it's a must! My husband and our female friend shared a medium BBQ chicken pizza and almost finished the whole pie. I didn't try the pizza, but they both raved about how great it was.
author: mimi c.

description: Horrible service we saw our waiter 3 times once to get our order once to bring our food and last was to bring our check!
author: Jeffrey C.

description: this is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. They charge $8.99 for a simple cesar salad that lacked freshness. The service is terrible and our waiter smelled loke body odor. I am a local and I will never take out of town guests to the pier 39 location.
author: Laura W.

description: This place was very disappointing. Took forever to even get a seat, after finally getting seated, we weren't even offered water, or menus. I had to stop a bus boy to get menus and request water. Once we got those, we had been seated, inside for a half hour. In my opinion, it should not take that long to get any type of recognition at a restaurant. We even tried to order our food, and it didnt arrive for another 45 minutes. we had asked for them to go, and will never be going back here again. Worst experience ever.
author: Amanda J.

description: I came here on a very busy weekend and didn't expect to be seated. I was surprised with how quickly we got a table. The server put us in a booth with an amazing view of the bay. The server told me about their famous clam chowder so I gave it a shot. He wasn't kidding. Possibly the best I've ever had!! The pizza was awesome as well. You can tell they use the freshest ingredients. I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting or living San Francisco.
author: Jeff H.

description: There are so many negatives, I can't think of a positive. The service is horrible and they forgot a part of our order. The food was extremely bland. I'm never in the rest of my life ever returning to this horrid place ever again. Also, it was overpriced on top of all of that.
author: S. K.

description: When you first walk in, you see what looks like a fun & quaint pizza place. however, dont be fooled. I went with family, there were 4 of us (adults) and my son who is 4. They advertise all you can eat pizza and pasta for $12.95 and children 4 and under eat free. The pizza and pasta looked like left overs from hometown buffet. The clam chowder, which i had HIGH expactations for since we were on the peer was watery and not worth finishing. The drinks were $2.50 each and we were charged $8.00 for gratuity, that was NEVER mentioned at all, for just the 4 of us. Our server came by only once when we first got there, and one other time when we were nearly finished to refill our drinks. Also, we never recieved any silverware and when i went to ask for a few sets I was told they were washing them.... What the heck? I also understand the whole appearance of pier side dining and leaving all the windows and doors open, but there were flys everywhere. I must say I was extremely dissapointed, I was starving after walking the entire Embarcadaro... And not getting the buffet I only ordered and unworthy $4 cup of soup. And adding gratuity to a 4 person party that pretty much served themselves the whole time? No Thanks. Needless to say, I wont be giving them a second chance.
author: gypsy s.

description: Great reasonably priced option at Pier 39.  Beautiful View.  Good service.  After walking around all day, it was nice to sit down, have a cold beer, and eat some delicious pizza.  My favorite was the bbq pizza.
author: Andrew O.

description: I visit the Pier very often throughout the year and I would have to say that today my visit was less than satisfactory. We ate at Luigi's Pizzeria, because we really enjoyed it when it was North Beach Pizza. I do NOT like the change. Luigi's Pizzeria had very poor service. We got the buffet which we had to continually ...wait for the pizza to come out. Our server Randy lets say was not very friendly and hardly brought us refills or anything. Not to mention him standing over the serving plates scratching his head and ear and then handling the plates and silverwear. author: Vanessa J.

description: I coordinated a trip to San Francisco for 35 international students and I was looking for a place on Pier 39 that we could eat lunch.  I worked with Todd, the manager, to work out a group price and he was incredibly helpful and flexible.  They reserved half the restaurant for us and made the process very easy.  The pizza was DELICIOUS and we really appreciated also having access to the soup bar and salad bar.  The views are beautiful and the staff was fantastic, I HIGHLY recommmend Luigi's if you're stopping for lunch on the pier!
author: I.P. C.

description: We had a surprise birthday party here --  The view was fantastic, the staff was great, and I could have eaten the garlic bites all night long.  The kids enjoyed the pizza and the adults enjoyed wine, salad bar, & some wickedly good raviolis!  Yes, it's in the heart of a tourist trap, but it is good enough for SF natives.
author: Cory M.

description: A little hard to find but worth it. I had the all you can eat buffet reasonably priced, and my friend had the shrimp with pasta and we both really enjoyed the food. Good service too! Great View!
author: Elaine C.

description: I would this restaurant a "negative" star, but it doesn't exist. We were there tonight with our young kids and after we sat down and had a very friendly host sit us down, we waited for a waiter.....and waited....and waited....for about 15 minutes. The restaurant wasn't full and they had 3 servers standing around by the buffet table talking. Two of them passed by our table several times, made eye contact with me and my husband but said nothing. We smiled at them hoping that one of them could come up to our table and at least let us know that they will be with us or someone else will....but it never happened. 15 minutes later, we saw they seated a white couple at one table and another white family at another table. (I make this point because we are minorities and we felt that was part of the issue at this point) The people that they JUST seated immediately had a server at their table and we gathered up our things and started to walk out. It was then the server came up and said, "Oh, sorry..I didn't know you were" WTF?! He passed by us several times and so did the other server and they didn't see us!!?? Seriously, did we blend in with the booth? We had two kids with us and I'm sure our toddler made some sort of noise that someone from across the restaurant heard! Ridiculous! We were the only minorities in the restaurant and they "DIDN'T SEE" us?! Yeah, right! This experience just put a very sour taste in my mouth that made me NOT want to eat anywhere in SF. I was so irritated at this point that we came home (30 miles away!) to go to a local pizzeria to get their food. Thank goodness for neighborhood joints! Bottom line, if you're a minority, don't come here! They "won't see you" at the booth 'cause you'll just blend in! This place is AWFUL!!!!!!!
author: Ruth A.
